alimentation . r√©duire viande . par deu.description:
> ... or in the evening

It is possible to significantly reduce the footprint of your diet
without becoming strictly vegetarian.

Replace half of your meat meals with vegetarian meals.

alimentation . r√©duire viande . par qua.description:
It is quite possible to significantly reduce the footprint of your diet
without becoming strictly vegetarian.

On this gesture, we replace 3/4 of your meat meals by vegetarian meals,
which is a good approximation of a meat consumption reserved for the
weekends.

alimentation . r√©duire viande . par qua.description: We compensate the division by 4 of the meat dishes by vegetarian dishes.

alimentation . devenir v√©g√©tarien.description:
Adopt a vegetarian diet, i.e. without meat or fish (but with eggs, milk,
cheese, yoghurt).

Less strong than the vegan diet, it already allows a very important
reduction of the footprint on the climate.

alimentation . viande faible empreinte.description:
The climate footprint of our food is directly correlated to our
consumption of meat, but it is important to know that not all meat is
equal in this respect.

> As a comparison, a steak per kilo emits 6 times more greenhouse gases
> than a chicken fillet.

To learn more about the impacts of our meat consumption, please read
the[full
explanation](/actions/plus/alimentation/r√©duire-viande/par-deux).

alimentation . viande faible empreinte ..description: We compensate for the deletion of the meat dish 2 in meat dish 1.

alimentation . manger local.description:
Local food allows us to reduce the transport distances of the products
we consume. However, even if it may seem counter-intuitive, local food
can, depending on the case, be unfavorable in terms of greenhouse gas
emissions: the impact of the origin of our products cannot be summed up
in a comparison between short and long distance. The effects of scale,
the centralization of products, the efficiency of the transport used (or
conversely the lack of efficiency) make the matter more complex from a
carbon accounting point of view.

Nevertheless, local food has many other positive impacts, first of all
by supporting the farmers of our regions!

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetalized diets, which is not
taken into account here.

alimentation . gaspillage alimentaire.note: In the referenced document, page 7 for the waste footprint and page 36 for the average reduction.

alimentation . manger de saison.description:
Contrary to what one might imagine, the impact of this action is
relatively low because the share of seasonal products is very low in the
average French person's diet.

But there are many other benefits to seasonal food such as the lower
consumption of water, the diversity of crops, or the lower dependence on
hydrocarbons (gas and oil) that heat the greenhouses.

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetated systems, which is not
taken into account here.
alimentation . manger de saison.note: To learn more about the calculation method, browse its formula, the variables will be explained.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
Bottled water has an environmental impact 450 times higher than tap
water. It costs between 100 and 300 times more (80% of the price comes
from the production of the packaging) and contributes greatly to the
plastic pollution of the oceans.

> Indeed, it is common that our plastic waste is sold to other
> countries. Thus in 2016, no less than 50% of sorted European plastic
> waste was exported to China.

More information on plastic waste management in the [full
explanation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/actions/plus/alimentation/d%C3%A9chets/vrac)

Sources: [Ecobalance of drinking
water](http://esu-services.ch/fileadmin/download/jungbluth-2015-ecobilan-eau.pdf)
and [Ministry of Ecological Transition
p106](https://www.economie.gouv.fr/files/files/directions_services/cge/filieres-dechets-recyclage.pdf)

alimentation . d√©chets . r√©duire gaspi.description:
In France, the average food waste is estimated at 30 kg per person per
year, including 7 kg of food still wrapped!

If we take a step back and consider the entire value chain (i.e. from
the field to the plate) it is about 10 million tons of food that are
wasted per year, or 150 kg per capita.

Reducing food waste is therefore essential in order to avoid producing
to throw away!

You will find useful tips and practices
[here](https://agirpourlatransition.ademe.fr/particuliers/conso/alimentation/pourquoi-gaspillons-autant-nourriture)

alimentation . d√©chets . avoir un stop.description:
It is a sticker to be placed on your mailbox that informs the
advertising distributors that you refuse to receive catalogs,
promotions, restaurant menus and advertisements of any kind.

This does not prevent all advertising, but it sends a strong signal and
generally reduces considerably the amount of paper waste received.

alimentation . d√©chets . composter.description:
Our bio-waste, i.e. the putrescible waste from our food (peelings,
leftovers, etc.), represents a large part of the weight of our grey
garbage can, thus contributing to increase the carbon footprint
associated with waste management. This waste is very often little or
poorly recycled despite the environmental benefit it can bring: compost,
a rich organic substance that is beneficial to the soil. Composting our
biowaste (individually or collectively) allows us to reduce the size of
our garbage cans and to encourage the creation of compost that can
eventually be used as an alternative to chemical fertilizers.

alimentation . boisson . chaude.question: What is your hot beverage consumption in a typical week (number of cups per week)?
alimentation . boisson . chaude.description:
Your hot beverage consumption for a typical week. One coffee a day? Tea
every night? Hot chocolate for breakfast?

Note that you can select the type of milk you drink in another question!

> The coffee or tea you drink at breakfast is to be taken into account
> here!

alimentation . boisson . chaude . chocol.question: Number of hot chocolates per week

alimentation . boisson . tasse de caf√©.formule: empreinte caf√© moulu * quantit√© caf√© par tasse

alimentation . boisson . tasse de caf√©.note: it is assumed that a cup of coffee contains an average of 12 grams of ground coffee.

alimentation . boisson . tasse de th√©.formule: empreinte th√© infus√© sans consommation * quantit√© th√© par tasse

alimentation . boisson . tasse de th√© ..formule: empreinte th√© infus√© * (1 - part consommation empreinte th√© infus√©)
alimentation . boisson . tasse de th√© ..note:
For the footprint of a cup of coffee or hot chocolate, the portion
related to consumption (heating of water in particular) is not taken
into account in the emission factor, which is not the case for the
emission factor of tea from Agribalyse. If the drink is drunk at home,
the consumption is already included in the electricity bill of the home.
However, if it is taken in a caf√©, the consumption footprint must be
added. We have chosen not to include the consumption of hot drinks (the
share linked to consumption being negligible for coffee and hot
chocolate before coffee beans or cocoa)
we assume that a cup of tea is on average 250 grams.

empreinte lait * quantit√© lait par tasse

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description: It is assumed that each person drinks 1.5 liters of water per day.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.note:
Carbon base consulted on 21/07/2022 (agribalyse).

> Mineral water - bottled 0.28 kgCO2e/kg net weight.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.question: Do you drink your water in bottles?
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
If you mainly drink tap water and your consumption of bottled water is
limited to rare occasions (for example one meal on the go at a bakery
per week, with their famous "sandwich + dessert + plastic bottle drink"
menu), answer no.

If you regularly buy packs of bottled water at the supermarket or if you
buy a small bottle every day at the canteen at work, answer yes.

> Know that drinking tap water has such a small climate footprint that
> we won't ask you about your food water consumption.
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.note:
The French drink on average between 100 and 150 liters of bottled water per year [source](https://www.planetoscope.com/consommation-eau/854-litres-d-eau-en-bouteille-vendus-en-france.html), which is about one third of our needs of 1-1.5l per day [source](https://www.mangerbouger.fr/Le-Mag/Bien-etre/L-eau-indispensable-a-notre-bonne-sante).

We considered the default value to be "no".

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es.description:
Note that alternatives to soda, very simple to prepare at home, are
possible: this is the case of
[kefir](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%A9fir) or
[Kombucha](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kombucha). We have not yet
evaluated the footprint gains offered by these alternatives.

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . fact.formule: (facteur sodas + facteur jus de fruits + facteur sirops) / 3
alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . fact.note: This value is of course very approximate.
FE from agribalysis (Cola, sweet), 0.57 kgCO2e/kg. Density is considered to be 1kg/l.
FE from agribalysis (Multifruit juice, pure juice, standard), 0.8 kgCO2e/kg. Density is considered to be 1kg/l.
FE from agribalysis, 1.06 kgCO2e/kg. The density is considered to be 1kg/l.

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . litr.question: What is your weekly consumption of sodas, fruit juices, syrups, etc.?

alimentation . boisson . alcool.description:
Surprisingly, our alcohol consumption plays a significant role in our
footprint.

The good news is that we can improve it in very simple ways: more than
food, a drink is heavy, travels a lot, and its packaging has a
significant footprint.

> Let's take the example of a üç∫ 25cl beer: brewed at the end of the
> world, it has traveled thousands of miles and its contents (the drink)
> are packaged in a container that weighs almost the same (200g of
> glass).

> By favoring a locally brewed beer, served on draft (the keg being
> reused for years), we can drastically reduce the footprint without
> changing the consumption.

alimentation . boisson . alcool . facteu.note: Wine doesn't have the same footprint as beer by the liter, that's a big simplification.
FE from agribalysis, 1.09 kgCO2e/kg. The density of the beer is considered to be 1kg/l.
FE from agribalysis, 1.12 kgCO2e/kg. The density of the wine is considered to be 1kg/l.
FE from agribalysis (punch type cocktail), 0.98 kgCO2e/kg. The density of a cocktail is considered to be 1kg/l.

alimentation . boisson . alcool . litres.question: What is your weekly consumption of alcohol (wine, beer, etc.)?

alimentation.description:
What we eat, and to a lesser extent what we drink, largely influences
our climate footprint.

The first factor is the quantity of meat and dairy products: - the
production of a kilo of meat emits CO2, but also other gases (such as
methane) which warm up the climate much more quickly - we have to feed
the animals with cereal products that we could have eaten ourselves,
often resulting from deforestation.

Contrary to what we often hear, the distance our food travels, the
seasonality of fruits and vegetables, and the amount of plastic
packaging are in the background.

alimentation . laitages.description:
This question is important at least in France, where cow's milk is
widely consumed and where gastronomy is renowned for its cheese.
alimentation . laitages.note:
The following quantities are found in MicMac.

> Cheese portion : 0,05kg Dairy portion : 0,125kg

Then the quantities of 3 categories are asked in kg/week : cheese and butter, dairy products, milk.

alimentation . plats.question: Choose your lunch and dinner dishes for a typical week
alimentation . plats.description:
Choose 14 dishes that represent your typical week: 7 lunches and 7
dinners.

> Today we are working to ensure that the menus associated with your
> meals are as representative as possible of your habits. Feel free to
> go further by browsing [the
> documentation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/alimentation/plats).
alimentation . plats.note:
We limit the choice for now to 4 schemes. They are based on the representative schemes [documented by ADEME](https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD_DOC_FR/index.htm?repas.htm).

The meat meals are only declined with a "classic" quantity of meat.

We add the vegan diet, a variation of the vegetarian diet.

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©talien.description:
Meals without animal products.

Here is the typical menu used for our calculation.

| Ingredients | Qty (g) | Kcal | Protein (g) | Fat (g) | gCO2e /kg
|:-:|:-:|:-:| | Starter: vegetable salad | 200g seasonal vegetables |
200 | 60 | 3 | 0 | 267 | 53.4 | French nuts in season | 10 | 71 | 1.3 |
6.7 | 13.3 | oil (1/2 tbsp.) | 7 | 63 | 0 | 7 | 2153 | 15.1 | | Main
course: marinated tofu, potatoes and onions | | | | tofu | 150 | 128 |
16 | 8 | 982 | 147.3 | | potatoes | 200 | 170 | 3 | 0.2 | 77 | 15.5 |
oil (1/2 c.s.) | 7 | 63 | 0 | 7 | 2153 | 17.1 | Dessert: fruit salad | |
| | seasonal fruit | 200 | 100 | 2 | 0 | 267 | 53.4 | Bread | 50 | 125 |
4 | 0.6 | 1520 | 76 | | Total | 776 | 29.3 | 29.5 | 393.9 |

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©talien . em.note:
For now, in the absence of a typical vegan meal in the [carbon
base](https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD_DOC_FR/index.htm?repas.htm),
we take the footprint of the vegetarian meal, in which we substitute the
2 eggs with tofu and nuts in the appetizer which then becomes a salad,
keeping approximately the same amounts of calories and protein.

> Note: one might wonder why the recipe mentions an onion omelet without
> including the onions. Negligible?

#### Adding the tofu

For tofu, we rely on the [Greenhouse Gas Emissions Generated by Tofu
Production: A
Case](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/317987931_Greenhouse_Gas_Emissions_Generated_by_Tofu_Production_A_Case_Study#read)
Study. The concordance of the two footprint assessment methods remains
to be verified, and let us note that the study itself metioned other
studies assessing a footprint 2 times larger (which is still much less
than animal products). The study tells us the following:

> Total CO2e from packaged tofu were 982 g/kg, 9820 g/kg of protein,
> 1150 g/1000 calories, and 336 g/retail packet of 396g. our tofu
> contained 850 kcal and 109 g protein per kilogram.

We consider that tofu contains 5g of fat per 100g.

Let's finally note that the tofu considered here could be replaced by
French soy and a decarbonized French tofu manufacturing, notably to
avoid deforestation and reduce emissions even more, giving rise to a
local vegan diet. See [this
paper](https://www.nature.com/articles/s43016-020-0106-x) about soy and
deforestation.

#### Adding nuts

For nuts, we add 1 kernel (10g without the shell), and we use the
climate footprint of the ADEME
[FoodGES](https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/actualite/actualite/detail/id/23)
database, `1,3kgCO2e/kg ingested`, and the nutritional values of [the
Wikipedia page](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noix#Valeur_nutritive).

alimentation . plan√©taire.description:
A diet described in 2019 to reconcile health and environment.

Lots of vegetables and fruits, lots of whole grains, proteins and
vegetable oils, a little milk and cheese, a little meat and fish, and a
little added sugar.

Unlike the vague "flexitarian" diet, the planetary diet is [described
very
precisely](https://www.culture-nutrition.com/2019/01/28/modele-alimentaire-regime-planetaire/).

![](https://eatforum.org/content/uploads/2019/02/EAT-Lancet_PHD_Plate_RGB-02.png)

alimentation . petit d√©jeuner . type.description:
There is an infinite variety of breakfasts. We have selected a few for
you to easily find an answer.

Even if you can't find your exact breakfast, choose the one that comes
closest!

> Please note that your consumption of fruit juice / coffee / tea / hot
> chocolate will be counted later.

alimentation . petit d√©jeuner . type ..description:
We have chosen to consider a standard French breakfast close to the
["continental"](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/D√©jeuner#Repas_de_type_continental)
breakfast. It includes bread, butter, jam, pastries and a fruit.

A bowl of milk or yogurt with cereal. The origin (animal or vegetable)
of the milk you drink will be asked later!

A salty breakfast: toasts, eggs, cold cuts. We have lightened the
traditional [English or Irish
breakfast](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petit_d√©jeuner_anglais) which
also includes baked beans, sausages, tomatoes, mushrooms, potatoes.

You don't eat anything for breakfast (but you can drink coffee, tea or
hot chocolate which is counted in another question).

alimentation . local . consommation.question: Do you consume local products?
alimentation . local . consommation.description:
This question allows us to adjust the footprint of your diet based on
your habit about how local your purchases are.

We consider "local" to be food that comes from the region where you live
or nearby regions. If you eat "French", consider your food local.

This criterion has a relatively small impact because the share of
transportation in the carbon footprint of the products we consume is
small compared to the emissions related to production, processing or
packaging, especially when your diet is meat.

But it's still a win-win, and the benefits of eating locally don't stop
at the climate footprint.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Beware, if you drive several miles from home each week to shop,
> it's possible that the last mile footprint exceeds the gains of eating
> locally!
alimentation . local . consommation.note: See details of the calculation approach [here](http://nosgestesclimat/documentation/alimentation/local/part-locale)

alimentation . local . niveau.description:
A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied in the case where the user
indicates that he consumes "sometimes" or "often" local respectively.

alimentation . local . part locale.description:
In a first approach, we chose to work on the menus proposed in the
simulator by considering the emission factors of Agribalyse, updated by
dividing the share of transport by 2.
alimentation . local . part locale.note:
These coefficients are obtained by reconstituting typical meals from the
Carbon Base with equivalent products from Agribalyse and considering a
share of transport divided by 2. More concretely the ratio =
reconstituted dish with a transport share divided by 2 / reconstituted
dish.

üßÆ The detailed calculation is [available
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/data/alimentation/alimentation%20.%20local.ods)
as a spreadsheet.

alimentation . de saison . consommation.question: Do you eat seasonal products?
alimentation . de saison . consommation.description:
This question allows us to correct the footprint of your diet according
to your habit on the seasonal character of your purchases.

This impact is relatively small because the share of seasonal products
represents only 7% of the average French person's diet.

But it's still a win-win situation, and the benefits of seasonal
consumption do not stop at the climate footprint.

> But what is the season of an apple or a cauliflower? Discover our
> mini-site [My fruits and vegetables in
> season](https://mesfruitsetlegumesdesaison.fr).
alimentation . de saison . consommation.note: See details of the calculation approach [here](http://nosgestesclimat/documentation/alimentation/de-saison/pourcentage-saisonable)

alimentation . de saison . niveau.description:
A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied in the case where the user
indicates that he/she consumes "sometimes" or "often" of season
respectively.

alimentation . de saison . ratio.description:
This coefficient of 2.42 is derived from Agribalyse by averaging the
ratios of the same product considered "in season" and "out of season".

This coefficient is subject to a high degree of uncertainty since the
in-season/out-of-season data only concerns 2 products in Agribalyse
(tomatoes and strawberries).
alimentation . de saison . ratio.note:
This calculation method is imperfect: ideally, we could make the
difference between in-season and out-of-season on each dish of the
user's personalized diet. But Agribalyse does not yet give the
seasonal/unseasonal cut for each food.

However, it does have the merit of giving a first order of magnitude.

üßÆ The spreadsheet for the detailed calculation is [available
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/data/alimentation/alimentation%20.%20de%20saison%20.%20ratio.ods).

alimentation . de saison . part saisonab.formule: pourcentage saisonable * (petit d√©jeuner annuel + d√©jeuner et d√Æner)
alimentation . de saison . part saisonab.description:
The percentage of seasonal products is applied to an individual's total
meals.

alimentation . de saison . pourcentage s.description:
In a first approach, we chose to estimate the share of the footprint of
seasonal products in the footprint of the [average French
meal](https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD_DOC_FR/index.htm?repas.htm)
calculated from the INCA 3 survey (2017).

These products correspond to fruits and vegetables likely to be
purchased "directly" in season, but also other processed products, such
as fruit juices, soups, compotes, that can be purchased with knowledge
of the production date of the product.

We have chosen to exclude potatoes from the calculation since they can
be harvested almost all year round thanks to the many varieties of
potatoes.
alimentation . de saison . pourcentage s.note:
This method of calculation is imperfect: ideally, we could make the
difference between seasonal and non-seasonal on each dish of the user's
personalized diet. However, in a future version of the calculation we
will be able to differentiate the percentage for each element of the
diet.

However, it has the merit of giving a first order of magnitude.

üßÆ The spreadsheet of the detailed calculation is [available
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/data/alimentation/alimentation%20.%20de%20saison%20.%20pourcentage%20saisonable.ods).

alimentation . d√©chets.description:
We have classified this item in the "Food" category because a large part
of our waste has a food origin (85% of the packaging thrown away by
households is food packaging)

alimentation . d√©chets . quantit√© jet√.question: How would you estimate the amount of waste you throw away?
alimentation . d√©chets . quantit√© jet√.description:
If you don't know, answer 'I throw away regularly'. Answer 'Zero Waste'
only if you track every single waste.

To learn more about zero waste lifestyles, visit [Zero Waste
France](https://www.zerowastefrance.org/passer-a-laction/adopter-zero-dechet/).

> Please note that in the case of a zero waste commitment, we still
> consider emissions (but greatly reduced) because it is very difficult
> if not impossible to generate no waste, some being invisible and
> unavoidable.

You consider that you frequently throw away waste and that you still
have progress to make to reach the zero waste level. However, are you
implementing eco-gestures to reduce your impact? Select this answer and
go to the next question!

A particularly strong level of commitment! The size of your trash can is
minimal, you *hardly* ever throw away!

alimentation . d√©chets . notif z√©ro d√.description:
You have entered a zero waste lifestyle. It is important to know that
this level of commitment corresponds to a person who is **100%**
committed to **reducing waste**. Consuming in bulk is not enough to be
zero waste.

somme: omr . putrescibles . non compostable + omr . putrescibles . compost√©s

alimentation . d√©chets . niveau z√©ro d.note:
It is considered that the proportion of people actually living without generating any waste is not very representative even within the zero waste movement. Thus,
we consider that a zero waste lifestyle corresponds to a division by 4 of all the other quantities of waste (MSW, CS and landfill).
Only putrescible waste is excluded from the reductions made because it does not concern packaging.

alimentation . d√©chets . niveau moyen.description: This level corresponds to the French average.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes.question: What eco-gestures do you put in place to reduce your waste?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes.description:
The different actions you can already take to reduce your trash
footprint.
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes.note: A mosaic for zero waste eco-gestures.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . compo.question: Do you compost your biowaste?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . compo.description:
Bio-waste includes food waste (but not all of it!), soiled paper and
cardboard and some green waste.

alimentation . d√©chets . omr . putresci.formule: omr . putrescibles * ((quantit√© r√©elle - gisement r√©duction) / quantit√© r√©elle)

alimentation . d√©chets . omr . putresci.note:
It is considered that only the putrescible waste is actually composted. The rest of the waste follows the classic outlet
of the OMR

Source: potential reduction of the deposit between 40 and 70 kg from section 4.13.3.3. page 84 of [the ADEME study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
The EF considered is: Kitchen waste and green waste - Domestic composting in bins - Impacts

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . gaspi.question: Are you looking to reduce your food waste (whether or not the products have been cooked)?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . gaspi.description:
If you make little or no effort to avoid throwing away your food, answer
no. On average, food waste is still the norm.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . gaspi.note:
It should be noted that there is a double counting with the end of life of non combustible losses at the consumer already taken into account in the FE meals
of the Carbon Base. However, this double counting is not very significant.
To go further in this discussion, including questions of scope and comparison with the FAO international study, see our comments [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1096#issuecomment-945158967).

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop.question: Do you have a stop sign on your mailbox?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop.description:
It is a sticker to be placed on your mailbox that informs the
advertising distributors that you refuse to receive catalogs,
promotions, restaurant menus and advertisements of any kind.

This does not prevent all advertising, but it sends a strong signal and
generally reduces considerably the amount of paper waste received.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.note: We consider 3 flyers per week in his mailbox

Source: Case 2 of the table on page 103 of [the ADEME study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
This is the most unfavorable case because it includes the transfer to electronic communication

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . achet.question: Do you buy in bulk?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . achet.note:
For the moment, this getse remains inactive. The impact being relatively
weak compared to the total quantity of waste, it will be a question of
deepening the figure resulting from [the study ADEME on the deposits of
avoidance](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
gave a potential of reduction of 2.4kg/inhab/year by consuming in bulk.

[Another](https://librairie.ademe.fr/consommer-autrement/5064-panorama-et-evaluation-environnementale-du-vrac-en-france.html)
more recent and more complete[ADEME
study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/consommer-autrement/5064-panorama-et-evaluation-environnementale-du-vrac-en-france.html)
is to be investigated to specify this impact.

We could also act directly on the quantity of packaging, cardboard and
plastic, of the waste sub-items. (ex food . waste . gestures . omr .
plastics . quantity)

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.note: A more recent and comprehensive study to be investigated to clarify this action: https://librairie.ademe.fr/consommer-autrement/5064-panorama-et-evaluation-environnementale-du-vrac-en-france.html.

Source: Page 47 of [the ADEME study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
According to the table, 22% of packaging avoided is paper/cardboard, 78% is plastic.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.titre: Average reduction per capita of the "buy in bulk" action
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.note:
Source: Page 47 of [the ADEME
study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
Based on the 11 product categories detailed above, the packaging
avoidance target of the bulk sales alternative can be estimated at 2.4
kg/inhabitant/year in 2012 at the national level. These results only
concern a limited number of products, but these are the ones that are
often offered for sale in bulk. These data take into account the removal
of product packaging by the bulk device, but do not take into account
the containers offered to customers for this purchase, so the actual
avoidance of the action is less.

bilan.description:
Here is an estimate of your climate footprint for the year. It evolves
according to your answers.

It is your share of greenhouse gas emissions, and therefore of global
warming.

All the footprints of companies are included. For example, if you drive
a car üöó 10 km, the emissions are not attributed to the country that
extracted this oil from the ground, nor to the company that refined it
and distributed it in gas stations, but to the final consumer in his
car.

If we add up this footprint for each French person and each other üåç
earthling, we get the total impact of human activities on the climate.

*Note: this simulator gives the order of magnitude of your footprint and
that of the French: the estimate is not to be taken to the nearest
tenth.*

But what does it mean, this ten tons of CO‚ÇÇ equivalent? Why is it
important? **We tell you all about the climate footprint** and how to
locate this footprint (low, high?) [‚û° in this
article](https://datagir.ademe.fr/blog/budget-empreinte-carbone-c-est-quoi/).

p√©trole . pleins.note:
For the moment, the chosen calculation method is based on an EROI
(Energy Return On Investment) or ERR (Energy Rate of Return) approach.
However, this model has some shortcomings: - Few primary sources - The
input energy is considered to be oil (i.e. 100% of the energy used to
extract, refine and transport the finished oil is oil) - No distinction
is made between fuels Other possibilities are studied
[here](https://hackmd.io/8dZWonjHSVyCKlNXCFT7sw) (energy approach,
barrel approach)

p√©trole . prix litre essence.note:
As this number varies greatly in time and space, it is probably best to avoid using it.

However, a public model of the price of fuel at the pump in France exists [here](https://github.com/laem/futureco/blob/master/carburants.yaml).

p√©trole . p√©trole brut.formule: conso tous carburants * facteur extraction * facteur raffinage

p√©trole . facteur extraction.note:
25% [Peak oil and the low-carbon energy transition A net-energy
perspective](https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-03360253/document).

> \[...\] by 2024, the production of oil liquids will require an amount
> of energy equal to 25% of its energy production.

Question: are we sure that this figure does not include refining?

p√©trole . facteur raffinage.note:
Figure taken from an article without a primary source
(https://energieetenvironnement.com/2018/12/19/le-fonctionnement-des-raffineries-de-petrole/)
A more reliable source is
the[UFIP](https://www.energiesetmobilites.fr/activites/raffinage/comment-fonctionne-une-raffinerie),
which speaks of a factor of 5 to 7% in France

Important note: it seems that in France, a large diesel consuming
country compared to the world average, we are under-equipped in
refineries. Thus, 40% of our diesel comes from Russia. See [this S&P
Global
infographic](https://twitter.com/Yvanldc/status/1512391163705237507/photo/1)
and [this Carfree.fr
article](http://carfree.fr/index.php/2022/03/09/larme-secrete-pour-vaincre-poutine/)
which sources via Le Figaro.

The oil refined in France has potentially different energy needs from
that refined in Russia.

p√©trole . litres gazole . voiture.applicable si: transport . voiture . thermique . carburant = 'gazole B7 ou B10'

variations.alors: transport . voiture . km * transport . voiture . thermique . consommation au kilom√®tre

variations.sinon: (transport . voiture . km / transport . voiture . voyageurs) * transport . voiture . thermique . consommation au kilom√®tre

p√©trole . litres gazole . bus.formule: part thermique * consommation . par t√™te * transport . bus . heures par semaine * nombre de semaines * transport . bus . vitesse

p√©trole . litres gazole . bus . remplis.note:
This is an order of magnitude, poorly sourced. Urban buses are on
average not very full, except in large cities.

It is difficult to obtain this kind of estimate. The RATP and Dunkerque
have just installed real-time counting devices, but it is impossible to
find average data for the year.

Another method is to trace the source of the calculation of the bus's
footprint per km in the carbon base. The average occupancy is
necessarily included, and this is probably a parameter that varies the
footprint according to the size of the urban area.

With a usage footprint of 0.137g/km.passenger, a [conversion factor of
~3](https://www.futura-sciences.com/planete/questions-reponses/automobile-carburant-emet-plus-co2-essence-gasoil-947/)
for upstream diesel included, we find a number of passengers of about 7.

p√©trole . litres gazole . bus . part th.Mais ce chiffre tend √† diminuer: 73.6% des nouveaux v√©hicules immatricul√©s en 2020 sont diesel, https://www.acea.auto/files/ACEA_buses_by_fuel_type_full-year_2020.pdf

une de ces conditions: transport . voiture . thermique . carburant = 'essence E5 ou E10'

gaz.description:
We calculate here the price of gas from the consumption of a household.

It is thus a question of including the various obligatory levies, as
well as the really significant subscription in the case of gas.

Attention, the gas market is largely liberalized, so the regulated rate,
which is the basis of our calculation, is no longer exclusive. We can no
longer subscribe to it, but the existing customers will be until 2023.

In 2022, there are two types of tariffs: the one that is indexed to the
regulated tariff, which is very close to it, and the completely free
tariffs, which are often fixed for a certain period of time.

We therefore assume that the regulated tariff remains representative of
the price of an average household.

Source for [the list of
taxes](https://www.energie-info.fr/fiche_pratique/cspe-ticgn-cta-tva-toutes-les-taxes-sur-ma-facture/).

gaz . volume.formule: logement . chauffage . gaz . consommation * facteur conversion

gaz . volume piscine.note: we consider a pool of 10 m x 5 m x 2 m (L x W x H)

divers . partage NGC.description:
In addition to the actions you can take, talking about this simulator to
your relatives, your colleagues, sharing it on social networks, etc. is
also a strong way to contribute to the reduction of CO2 emissions!

It's certainly a very small digital impact in addition (well less than
1kgCO2e, well unless you're a big network star ü§© !), but it's especially
potentially a lot of impact in terms of change! üìâ If these people decide
on the same actions as you, imagine the multiplier effect! üôå

divers . aider les autres.description:
There comes a time when gaining weight becomes very complicated.

If your footprint falls below 4 tons, or if certain constraints make
your progress impossible, you're probably better off helping others
reduce their footprint than torturing yourself over yours.

How can you do this? By distributing this simulator, by discussing these
topics with your friends and family, by leading workshops in your
company or association, or even by helping someone to change one of
their polluting habits.

divers . meubles . allongement.titre: Extend the life of my furniture

divers . publicit√©.description:
Through the desires they create in us, advertising and marketing incite
us to overconsumption and early renewal of our equipment. These
promotions serve to maximize the renewal rate and the volume of goods
sold, volumes that are very often disproportionate to the real demand.

Not renewing your appliances and equipment too early and making them
last as long as possible is a strong gesture for the climate.

> For example: - not renewing your smartphone early (after 2 years) is
> 16 kgCO2eq avoided - for your television (4 years) is 170 kgCO2eq
> avoided

If urban advertising (bus stops, giant billboards, supermarkets) is
complicated to ignore, note that it is easy to get rid of it **on the
Web** with an extension to install in [1
click](https://ublockorigin.com/fr) in your browser.

**On mobile**, it depends on your device:

On iPhoneTheiOS ecosystem \[is padlocked by
Apple\](https://support.mozilla.org/fr/kb/modules-complementaires-pour-firefox-sous-ios),
so there's not much you can do.

On AndroidYoucan use Firefox and install the muBlock extension, or
another browser from the app store that allows blocking (Chrome does
not). For applications, it is more complicated, but it is possible to
install alternative applications without ads (for example \[Youtube
Vanced\](https://vancedapp.com) or \[New Pipe\](https://newpipe.net) as
a replacement for the Youtube application) or to install a blocker for
all applications (for example \[Blokada\](https://blokada.org/))

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . allongement.formule: (divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils - divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils pr√©servation allong√©e) / logement . habitants
divers . √©lectrom√©nager . allongement.description:
Increasing the lifespan of your household appliances (by taking care of
them or repairing them when they break down) helps limit your impact on
the climate.

Renewing your equipment prematurely, on the other hand, contributes to
producing more equipment for the same service.

If you absolutely want to get rid of an object prematurely, think of the
ressourceries or recycleries, for example, which are places dedicated to
reuse! üòâ

finance.description:
You have to estimate here the value of your financial assets (divide by
2 if you are a couple with reduced community of acquests).

The carbon footprint is different between traditional investments and
responsible investments. When your savings "work", your bank invests in
projects that may have more or less climate impact.
finance.note:
Note that taking into account the footprint of your savings can lead to
what is called *double counting*.

For example: - I have money in a French bank, and it is suspected that
this money finances an oil company => I am attributed a part of the
impact of the production or combustion of gasoline - if I drive my car
for 1000km, I am attributed all the emissions of the 70l of gasoline

My balance sheet is therefore overestimated, because the same CO2
emission has been counted twice.

We are well aware of this pitfall, but have decided to keep it for the
following reasons: - the calculation of the footprint is complex, and we
underestimate many other items that "go under the radar" - the influence
of our money in the bank is real, liquidity being an essential
ingredient of an industrial operation - this climate footprint model is
above all intended to give orders of magnitude, not a footprint to
within 100kg

finance . actifs classiques.question: What are your savings in banks or traditional funds?

finance . actifs responsables.question: What are your savings in so-called "responsible" banks or funds?

humour . lecture AR5.description:
Read the IPCC report on your laptop.

The IPCC report is 5000 pages long, all very technical.

humour . lecture AR5 . temps de lecture.note: 5000 pages (order of magnitude) times 10 minutes of reading per page.

humour . lecture AR5 . empreinte usage ..description:
It is well known that a report of this type can only be read by the
light of a laptop in a dark and unheated room.
humour . lecture AR5 . empreinte usage ..note: It would be interesting to calculate the footprint of the candle, the symbol of the "ecologists" criticism.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager.note:
We only count here the footprint of the construction of the household goods, because their use involves mostly electricity, already counted via the kWh bill.

We consider that all appliances are used by the whole household.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils.question: What appliances are less than 10 years old?
divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils.description:
The bulk of the appliance footprint lies in the appliances we buy.

> ‚ú®Ô∏è For simplicity's sake, only fill in recent appliances: a
> 10-year-old refrigerator has already been well amortized.

If not all your appliances are offered in this list, it's okay, this
test is not meant to be exhaustive.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..note:
The lifespan of the equipment changes according to the preservation coefficient determined by the question on the efforts to preserve its equipment.

An answer "average effort" does not change the life span. Only the other answers increase or decrease the lifespan of the equipment and therefore the estimated carbon footprint.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..description:
A refrigerator with a built-in freezer. Often simply called a large
fridge or sometimes American fridge.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..question: Do you have a mini fridge?
Do you own a washing machine?
Do you own a coffee maker?
Do you own a vacuum cleaner?

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..note: We consider a vacuum cleaner without bag

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..question: Do you own a food processor?

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..note: no life span is given in the ADEME sources, so we consider a total life span of 6 years

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..question: Do you own an electric lawnmower?

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . appareils ..note: Source: Modelling and environmental assessment of consumer products and capital goods - Tab. 4.5 - Ademe

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . pr√©servatio.question: What effort do you make to keep your appliances as long as possible?
divers . √©lectrom√©nager . pr√©servatio.description:
To avoid asking you to give the precise age of the ten or so appliances
you own, we use a grid of the average age observed for each appliance.

For example, a fridge lasts on average 10 years, an oven 12 years and a
kettle 6 years. You can explore the average life and footprint of each
appliance [here](/documentation/divers/√©lectrom√©nager/appareils).

> It's not about the age of the appliance when it breaks down, but the
> age when the owner decides to replace it with a new one.

It's up to you to see how you stack up against the average.

divers . √©lectrom√©nager . coefficient.note:
We define a grid of consumption behaviors, from the almost compulsive
new buyer to the one who makes a significant effort to keep his
appliances as long as possible.

The new buyer keeps his appliances for half of their average lifespan,
while the one who keeps them pushes back their average lifespan from 10
years to 13 years.

This grid may evolve if new sources and studies are added.

divers . textile.question: What new clothes do you usually buy in a year?
divers . textile.description:
Tell us what you put in your shopping bags this year, or in a
representative year if you rarely store.

> If you buy a sweater every 2 years, round to `1`. If you buy a sweater
> every 3 years, round to `0`.

Enter only new products. We exclude from the calculation the purchase in
thrift stores, the recovery, the second hand.
divers . textile.note:
The data is all from Base Carbone except for the shorts, which are from
Base Impact data (textiles, linens, leather goods), and the two generic
items, which are rough estimates based on the visualization of the graph
of data in the ADEME documentation.

We did not use Base Impact data (except for the shorts) because even
though the data is the average of several products, many of them come
from only one company.

divers.description:
In this category, we have classified all the objects of our daily life,
from the t-shirt to the washing machine.

Digital technology is in another category, given its importance in the
French news in 2021.
divers.note:
Our model is clearly not comprehensive with respect to this item, so an underestimation of the footprint is likely.

So many everyday items (from bath mats to fire detectors to sunglasses...) are not yet included.

divers . autres produits . montant.question: How much do you spend per year on new manufactured goods (furniture, books, etc.)?
divers . autres produits . montant.description:
To keep the interface simple, we propose an estimate of the footprint of
this product category based on its cost.

However, it is not at all clear that a book that costs more has a larger
footprint.

Similarly, a plastic stool could very well have 5 times the footprint of
a solid wood crafted stool (wood captures CO2 as it grows), yet the
latter is likely to cost 2 times as much.
divers . autres produits . montant.note: This category is rather vague, at least more examples should be given.

logement . baisse temp√©rature.titre: Reduce the temperature of my heating by 1¬∞ or 2¬∞
logement . baisse temp√©rature.description:
Housing and in particular its heating (oil or gas) has a significant
impact on the climate.

Lowering the temperature by one or two degrees can be a way to reduce
its footprint.

Source : ADEME - [40 tips and tricks to save water and
energy](https://www.ademe.fr/40-trucs-astuces-economiser-leau-lenergie)
logement . baisse temp√©rature.formule: (nombre degr√©s * gains 1 degr√© * empreinte chauffage) / habitants

logement . baisse temp√©rature . nombre.question: How many degrees would you be willing to lower the set temperature of your home?
logement . baisse temp√©rature . nombre.description:
¬æ of a household's energy consumption is spent on heating and hot water.

This energy consumption, in addition to having a significant financial
cost, increases the carbon footprint of households.

However, it can easily be limited by lowering the temperature of the
occupied rooms without losing thermal comfort or feeling cold (provided
that the dwellings are well insulated).

For example, set the temperature between 19¬∞ and 21¬∞C in occupied rooms
during the day (and 17¬∞C at night or in rooms that are not very busy).

Indeed, lowering the heating temperature by 1¬∞C represents an energy
saving of 7%.

logement . temp√©rature.question: What temperature do you heat your home to?
logement . temp√©rature.description:
This question simply allows us not to suggest lowering the temperature
when it is already relatively low.

logement . baisse temp√©rature . gains 1.description:
This is the estimated decrease in energy expenditure when we lower the
temperature of our heated home by 1¬∞C in the usual temperature range
(around 20¬∞).

We use the estimate given in the [ADEME
guide](https://www.ademe.fr/40-trucs-astuces-economiser-leau-lenergie)
"40 tricks to save water and energy".
logement . baisse temp√©rature . gains 1.note: Where is the source for this 7%? Can this figure be broken down for each type of energy (wood, gas, etc.)? How sensitive is this figure to the type of housing, its insulation, etc.?

logement . √©teindre appareils.titre: Turn off my devices on standby
logement . √©teindre appareils.description:
Our apartments and homes are full of digital devices and appliances,
which often remain on or on standby.

The use of simple power strips makes it possible to turn them off
completely in the blink of an eye.

The standby have made progress and individually consume less than in the
past: a European directive applicable since January 2017 limits their
power. It is 0.5 W for a number of categories of devices, but 3 W for
devices that remain connected to the Internet or data networks.

Source: ADEME - [Reducing your electricity
bill](https://www.ademe.fr/sites/default/files/assets/documents/guide-pratique-reduire-facture-electricite.pdf),
page 18.

logement . √©nergie de veille . puissanc.description: > The total power of these lights for a household often exceeds 50
logement . √©nergie de veille . puissanc.note:
It is quite possible that we underestimate the number of Watt in
standby. In particular, it appears that the internet and TV boxes alone
consume more than 50 Watt.

> The "box" is an increasingly common piece of equipment, which often
> remains on 24 hours a day and generates a consumption that can exceed
> 200 kWh / year, or as much as the washing machine. Its total
> consumption over a year is between 150 and 300 kWh\*: that's as much
> as a large refrigerator

logement . √©nergie de veille . temps d'.description:
It is assumed that on average, one is not present at home half of the
time, or one sleeps. At night (8 hours) and on average 4 hours during
the day, to take into account the weekends which compensate for the 8
hour working days, and the fact that not everyone in the household is
absent at the same time.

logement . remplacer fioul par bois.titre: Replace my oil-fired boiler with wood
logement . remplacer fioul par bois.description:
Oil-fired boilers are the most polluting. Replacing them with less
carbon-intensive alternatives such as wood pellets is a great way to
reduce your carbon footprint.
logement . remplacer fioul par bois.note: We consider for the moment that replacing the kWh of fuel oil by the same amount of kWh of wood is a good first order approximation. We will be able to adapt it later on according to the performance of the residential installations.

logement . √©clairage . LED.description:
Replacing conventional light bulbs with low-energy LED bulbs can reduce
your electricity consumption by a factor of 6.

These bulbs consume very little electricity and have a very long life
(up to 40,000 hours for the A++ categories).

logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.titre: Switch from gas boiler to heat pump
logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.description:
Gas-fired boilers are among the most CO‚ÇÇ emitting. Replacing them with
lower-carbon alternatives like heat pumps is a strong move to reduce
your carbon footprint.

> Heat pumps are often referred to as *PACs*.

üí° Their principle is ingenious: it's a reverse fridge! Your fridge,
thanks to a little electricity, cools its interior and rejects the heat
into the room. The heat pump cools the outside air to heat your home.

> Bonus: if it's too hot in your home in the summer, some heat pumps can
> reverse their operation and act as air conditioning in the summer.
logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.note:
For now, we consider that replacing gas kWh with the same amount of electric kWh is a good first-order approximation. We will be able to adapt it later on according to the performance of residential installations.

This action figures the replacement of the gas boiler, if you also heat your water with gas it will be necessary to choose a heat pump that can also heat water.

Air-drying your clothes saves energy and preserves your clothes, making

logement . s√©chage air libre.note: 400 kWh is a value chosen on the basis of the annual kWh given by different manufacturers, the values ranging from 300 to 500+ kWh annum, 400 kWh has been retained.

logement . climatisation.description:
We are here the footprint of the air conditioning. Its footprint is
fourfold:  
- the electricity consumption (it is included in the consumption of the
housing) - the footprint of the construction of the equipment - the
footprint of the leakage of the heat transfer fluid - annual - at the
end of life
logement . climatisation.note:
We have a certain difference with the ADEME study because the assumptions are different from those of the Base Carbone, whereas the latter says it is based on this study.

The main differences come from

- the annual leakage rate considered: 1% in the ADEME study (tab p38) where my model averages the annual leakage rate of the residential sector given in the Base Carbone (4.2%)
- the fact that the ADEME study does not seem to take into account the leakage rate at the end of life (even if amortized) which is huge in the Base Carbone (average of 66,4 %)
- the fact that I consider in first estimation the refrigerant R410a where the study considers the R134a

logement . r√©novation √©nerg√©tique.description:
Energy renovation, despite its cost, allows, in the long term, very
strong energy savings and thus participates in reducing the carbon
footprint of your home.

These savings will be even more important if you live in a poorly
insulated home.

To find out which renovations are best suited to your home and what
assistance is available: [DO](https://www.faire.gouv.fr).

logement . gain r√©novation.note: Average energy gain after renovation on an ANAH program of 13,000 homes targeting "thermal flats".

logement . propri√©taire.question: Do you own your home?
logement . propri√©taire.description:
As a tenant, it is obviously delicate to make investments that improve
the footprint of the dwelling: insulation, change of energy source are
impossible unless you find a particularly accommodating landlord.

However, the law could be a strong support as soon as 2023: thermal
flats [will be forbidden to
rent](https://www.gouvernement.fr/interdiction-a-la-location-des-logements-avec-une-forte-consommation-d-energie-des-2023),
forcing owners to launch substantial works.

logement . r√©novation √©nerg√©tique BBC.description:
A low energy building (BBC) renovation can reduce the energy consumption
of your home by up to 70%.

This type of renovation also leads, in the long term, to a significant
reduction in the energy bill, especially if you live in a poorly
insulated home or even an energy sieve.

> We speak of thermal sieve for housing with an energy label F or G
> (there are over 7 million in France). These homes will [no longer be
> able to be rented in
> 2028](https://www.ladepeche.fr/2021/03/15/les-passoires-thermiques-interdites-a-la-location-a-partir-de-2028-9428622.php).

To find out which renovations are best suited to your home and what
assistance is available: [DO](https://www.faire.gouv.fr).

logement . r√©novation √©nerg√©tique BBC.note: Maximum energy gain achieved after a BBC renovation, source to be specified.

logement . √©lectricit√© verte.titre: Subscribe to a green electricity contract

logement . gaz . biogaz.note:
The carbon base uses the following biogas emission factor:
`0.0444 kgCO2e/kWhPCI`.

Here is more documentation on the integration of this figure and its
limitations.

Their justification is in the documentation \[unfold\] For
methodological reasons, this approach is not compatible with the
construction logic of the emission factors of the Base Carbone¬Æ and
cannot be used for a GHG emissions assessment. Therefore, additional
work has been carried out resulting in an updated Life Cycle Assessment
in 2020
\[\[144\]\](https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD\_DOC\_FR/references.htm)
and an emissions factor of 44.1 gCO2e / kWh PCI. This last value
reflects the GHG impact induced by the production of one kWh of
biomethane, contrary to the value of 23.4 gCO2e / kWh PCI from the
previous study, which reflects the overall impact of the methanization
and injection sector, integrating induced impacts and GHG emission
reductions brought by this sector

  

We will have to specify what in NGC prevents us from using the lowest
factor in the framework of this consumption calculation model, which is
a global calculation also covering agriculture via food.

Another crucial point is that gas can be stored, unlike "green"
electricity, which is why their emission factor has not been included in
NGC for the time being.

In addition, leaks from biomethane installations, which are by nature
much smaller and more numerous than fossil gas and therefore difficult
to control, could be underestimated. Is this [2022
study](https://www.cell.com/one-earth/fulltext/S2590-3322(22)00267-6)
taken into account in the above emission factor (2020)?

## About land use

The link from the carbon base to the GRDF study is no longer online.
[Here it is in
PDF](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/files/9542516/evaluation-des-impacts-ges-biomethane-_synthese-quantis_2017.pdf).
It shows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/189527416-4e8a3725-ef5a-448e-8557-0ad0007e0720.png)

Whose red share is detailed here :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/189527431-3fdcc5b2-22c0-49e1-b5f0-68762f780d57.png)

You can see there that dedicated crops are very low in proportion, which
is rather very reassuring.

That said, and I don't really know how to define it precisely, I still
have a strong impression that a large part of these components could be
valorized differently: concretely, we burn and thus valorize at a very
high sold price (gas in wholesale price [costs in September
2022](https://twitter.com/i/timeline) almost 2 times the production
price of biogas (90‚Ç¨/MWh)) the remains of chicken from the canteen that
we could have just not produced (blue); the domestic lawn that the
neighbor mows every week (light blue); the manure of crops that could
have been dedicated to human vegetation (purple); etc.

In short, if part of the energy present in the materials used by
biomethane was just lost, another part simply undergoes a change of
allocation, from something useful to the agricultural world to the
combustion of gas to heat dwellings in particular. Not to mention the
windfall effect for activities that emit, substitutable by others that
emit less. The study however seems very complete, so it is to be dug,
perhaps it answers all that and that I did not see (it is complex).

We can also quote [an article of
Reporterre](https://reporterre.net/methanisation-un-digestat-bien-indigeste-pour-les-sols-et-les-eaux)
which worries about bacterial contaminations due to the spreading of the
digestate as well as the leakage of methane and nitrogen protoxide N2O,
which would be underestimated (because they are well present and thus
evaluated in the study quoted by the carbon base). But beware,
Reporterre is not a research organization, but a media of opinion.

A very recent investigation on the methanizers in Brittany goes in the
same direction, cataloguing the incidents that have taken place in the
region:
https://basta.media/des-methaniseurs-menacent-l-environnement-la-carte-inedite-des-accidents-en-Bretagne-Splann.

This does not call into question the fact of including the factor in UCS
in my opinion. Fossil gas production is quite concerned by this kind of
problems too, as an example.

Another question that may be answered is this: can the sector do x10 in
production without introducing negative externalities that are currently
under control? It would be interesting to answer this question for the
UCS user, to show him that his choice can be passed on to society.
Carbone4 seems to answer negatively: the replacement of fossil gas by
biomethane should not lead to a non reduction of gas consumption in
general, and even less to a rebound effect!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/189527887-931ee20a-8ad6-431f-bd4d-d705fa9eefca.png)

A **warning** is therefore integrated during the simulation to evoke
this impossible scaling up:

> Biomethane **greatly** reduces the CO2 emissions of the gas you
> consume, but the current production is **unable to** scale up: the
> overall reduction of all gas consumption remains **essential**,
> whether you consume biogas or fossil gas.

parc fran√ßais.description:
The objective of this small model is to estimate the average values
associated with the dwelling (surface, surface heated with gas,
consumption by heating...) to obtain a total average footprint of the
dwelling which is representative of the average French person.

The difficulty is that some households heat with gas (~40%), electricity
(~40%), oil, wood, etc.

We therefore attribute as an average climate footprint the kWh footprint
of these energies weighted by their actual use in the French housing
stock.

fioul kWh au litre.note:
According to the carbon base (https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/accueil/documentation-gene/index/page/New_liquides),
the calorific value of heating oil is 42GT/T and its density is 845 kg/m3.
After conversion we find a factor of to pass from kWh to liter of fuel oil.

logement.description:
We can see our housing as a passive building that would not impact the
climate... we would be wrong!

The most important emission item for housing in France is heating the
air in which we live. The footprint will not be the same at all
depending on the heating technology.

But that's not all: construction, maintenance, hot water heating,
electricity, so many items that depend above all on a single parameter:
the number of m¬≤.

It is a question of knowing how many people share your home and all the
consumption it entails (construction, heating, etc.).

> If you live alone, answer `1`.

> If you live with your spouse and a child, answer `3`.

> If you are separated with a child who alternates between your home and

> The average surface area of the dwellings is approximately 91 m2.

logement . appartement.question: Is your home an apartment?
logement . appartement.description:
As opposed to an individual house.

The increase in apartment housing can make us forget that the house
remains the majority housing of French households in 2018.

This information influences in particular the construction footprint,
but also the possibilities of insulation work for example.

> If you live in an original habitat, for example a camper / a truck / a
> barge, no problem: choose "apartment" and enter the m¬≤ of what
> constitutes your housing anyway.
logement . appartement.note:
> In 2018, single-family housing accounts for 56% of housing units: it is the majority among primary residences as well as among secondary residences and occasional housing. After having increased between 1999 and 2008, its share is slightly decreasing because the number of collective housing units is increasing faster than that of individual housing units due to recent developments in new construction.
Note that this is a proportion of dwellings, but it is to be expected (and verified) that houses contain more people on average than apartments, which reinforces the choice of the default value.

logement . construction . par surface.note:

For the eco-built housing, we retain the emission factor of the carbon base, but it seems to be confirmed in order of magnitude in the Carbone 4 study.

> Gains observed on the fossil CO2 of the structural work (foundations and structure), compared to concrete. Carbon storage in the wood product is not taken into account.  Gains linked to material substitution: CLT wood building: 118 kgCO2e/m2 SHON, i.e. 473 kgCO2e/m3 of wood product. MI wood frame: 83 kgCO2e/m2 SHON, i.e. 2495 kgCO2e/m3 of wood product. LC wood CLT: 231 kgCO2e/m2 SHON, or 699 kgCO2e/m3 of wood product. LC wood frame: 139 kgCO2e/m2 SHON, i.e. 3172 kgCO2e/m3 of wood product.

r√©f√©rences.INSEE: 24% du parc de logements date d'avant 1949 et 24% entre 1949 et 1974 par exemple (https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/fichier/2586377/LOGFRA17.pdf).

logement . notif amortissement.description:
If your home is less than **50 years** old, we give you one fiftieth of
the footprint of its construction. **Otherwise, zero: the house is
depreciated.** You will not be asked questions about the characteristics
of your home because the annual footprint of its construction is
considered to be zero.

logement . construction.note:
The average home will last at least 50 years. This is a conservative value.

We consider here that the footprint of the construction of a dwelling is attributed each year to the 50th of the inhabitants of the first 50 years.

Thereafter, the construction footprint of the dwelling is set to zero.

Possible improvement: we lack data, but it should be possible to assign an annual footprint of the maintenance of the dwelling (renovation, insulation, interior work, etc.).

Here we use the average footprint of the mix in the simulation region.

We could do better, by separating the air heating part from the rest of

Check all the modes you use.

logement . chauffage . gaz . biogaz.question: Have you subscribed to a gas contract that includes biogas (or biomethane)?
logement . chauffage . gaz . biogaz.description:
Biogas or biomethane is a gas made from organic waste (household waste,
manure, lawn waste, crops etc.), unlike fossil gas, also misleadingly
called "natural", which is extracted like oil from the Norwegian or
Russian subsoil.

Since a few years, it is possible to subscribe to a contract that
guarantees the injection of the same quantity of biomethane into the
French gas network as your own consumption. The gas you consume in your
home will anyway be a mixture mainly composed of the methane molecule
(CH‚ÇÑ), but for each kWh of gas consumed, it will have been injected "on
your behalf" 1 kWh of biomethane.

> Unlike gas, electricity *is not stored*, which is why we do not offer
> a "green electricity" option in the simulator.

Attention, there are offers with 10%, 20% of biomethane only, if this is
the case answer "no".

logement . chauffage . gaz . avertisseme.description:
You will find that choosing biogas greatly reduces the climate footprint
of the gas you consume, but note that current production is unable to
scale up: the overall reduction of all gas consumption remains
essential, whether you consume biogas or fossil gas.

logement . gaz . facteur d'√©mission bas.note:
These are kgCO2e/kWh *PCI*.

Fossil gas: Natural gas - 2015 - average mix - consumption

gaz . marginal HT.description:
Marginal price of kWh excluding tax for a B1 package (kitchen, air and
water heating: 6000kWh to 30 000kWh/year)

We choose zone 2 because it seems the most representative (zone 1 has
more cities, most of the metropolises, but remains an extremity and
Paris is in 2). [Understanding the
zones](https://selectra.info/energie/guides/demarches/zone-tarifaire-gaz).

The scale of February 2022 is available on [the CRE
website](https://www.cre.fr/Actualites/publication-des-baremes-applicables-pour-les-tarifs-reglementes-de-vente-de-gaz-naturel-fevri%20er-2022).

Fixed part of the transmission tariff applied by the natural gas
distribution system operators for calculating the CTA,
[source](https://opera-energie.com/atrd-tarif-distribution-gaz-naturel).

gaz . consommation par d√©faut.description:
To calculate an estimate of the real price paid by households and to
deduct the kWh from it, we start from an arbitrary consumption.

gaz . prix total: part variable + abonnement avec TVA + CTA avec TVA

gaz . prix.description:
This is the factor that allows us to go from the price paid by the
household to the consumption in kWh.
gaz . prix.note:
Note that the calculation formula is of the type p = c \* a + b, where
p=price, c=cost, a=marginal cost including VAT, b = fixed cost.

Thus, we could have a much more reliable estimate of the consumption
from the price by reversing this equation.

But unfortunately our estimation form only works today with a
multiplication factor.

num√©rique . internet . diminuer.description:
Video streaming contributes to GHG emissions (even more so when you use
a mobile connection) because it requires a lot of infrastructure.

Limiting its consumption, in this case of one hour per day when you
spend more than 2 hours on it, and favouring alternatives such as
reading, allows you to reduce your digital carbon footprint.

num√©rique . internet . dur√©e journali√.description:
Here we propose to reduce the time spent watching online videos by one
hour.

num√©rique.description:
Digital is at the heart of environmental news since 2019.

Yet its footprint is not necessarily what we think: for example, the
multiple devices in our homes are surprisingly large.

num√©rique . internet . consommation hor.note:
This figure was used in the MicMac calculator version 2.6. The source is
a CarbonBrief article using IEA data, and criticizing the Shift Project
calculations.

> Taken together, my analysis suggests that streaming a Netflix video in
> 2019 typically consumed 0.12-0.24kWh of electricity per hour.

Here are other sources that give significantly different results: - 400
g CO2e for the [Shift
Project](https://theshiftproject.org/article/shift-project-vraiment-surestime-empreinte-carbone-video-analyse/)
(after correction) - 100 g CO2e for [Netflix
(DIMPACT)](https://www.wired.com/story/netflix-binge-watching-carbon-footprint/)
- 36 g CO2e for
the[IEA](https://www.iea.org/commentaries/the-carbon-footprint-of-streaming-video-fact-checking-the-headlines)
(even reduced to 4g for France if I understand correctly, because of the
carbon intensity of the electricity mix) - 28 g CO2e for
[Greenspector](https://greenspector.com/fr/impact-video-canal/) (for the
use of Canal + services)

To do: how do the source calculations weight the uses (streaming, web
browsing, etc.)?

Is it an estimate of data consumption per hour of use?

num√©rique . pr√©servation.question: What effort do you make to keep your electronics as long as possible?
num√©rique . pr√©servation.description:
To avoid asking you to fill in the exact age of all the electronic
devices you own, we use a grid of average age found for each device that
is scaled according to your efforts to preserve them or not.

You can explore the average age and footprint of each device
[here](/documentation/num√©rique).

It's up to you to judge your efforts to make them last as long as
possible

> Answering "I often buy new" is the most impactful answer because it
> means that you replace your devices early before they are out of use.

num√©rique . coefficient pr√©servation.note:
We define a grid of consumption behaviors, from the almost compulsive
new buyer to the one who makes a significant effort to keep his
appliances as long as possible.

The buyer who answers "I buy a lot of new" keeps his appliances for half
of their average lifespan, on the other hand the one who keeps them
pushes back an average lifespan from 10 to 13 years.

This grid may evolve if new sources and studies are added.

num√©rique . appareils.question: What digital devices do you own that are less than 10 years old?
num√©rique . appareils.description:
Most of the digital footprint is in the devices we buy. Fill in your
devices here.

> ‚ú®Ô∏è For simplicity, only fill in recent devices: a 10-year-old
> smartphone has already been well amortized. If you bought it used 3
> years ago and it was already about 2 years old, consider it 5 years
> old!

> üì° We will add other types of devices as we go along: internet box, TV
> box, 2nd TV, printer, etc..

num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone.description:
Phones, and especially recent smartphones, are the symbol par excellence
of *high-tech*, which is known to consume a lot of resources. The issue
is all the more important as they are often renewed regularly, for
example with each annual release of the new iPhone. In reality,
especially compared to the number of hours we spend on these small
objects, their climate footprint could be compatible with a sustainable
lifestyle. Illustration: A high-end phone (iPhone X) is < 100kgCO2e.
Assuming we buy this state-of-the-art smartphone every 2 years, we have
< 50kgCO2e/year. This represents half a percent of the average
footprint of a French person (11 tons). And 2.5% of a sustainable
footprint of 2 tons/year.
num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone.note: We estimate that the unit will last one year longer than the age given at the time of the estimate.

num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone . t.question: What phone do you have?
num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone . t.description:
A high-end smartphone is, for example, a recent iPhone with a large
screen (> iPhone X), or a recent Samsung Galaxy S or Note.

If you don't have a cell phone, chances are you have a landline. Answer
the question based on the sophistication of your landline phone,
including screen size. If you don't have a landline or cell phone,
sorry...

num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone . d.note: The lifetime is taken from this study [ADEME](https://librairie.ademe.fr/consommer-autrement/5226-evaluation-de-l-impact-environnemental-du-numerique-en-france-et-analyse-prospective.html), Report 2 Table 48 page 71

num√©rique . appareils . t√©l√©phone . i.description:
We segment the possibilities of this question into three categories.

## Basic phone

Also called "feature phone", which are today at the crossroads between
the famous Nokia 3310 and the smartphone, whose screen remains small and
components low-end

> Its footprint is given by the GES-balance.

## Classic smartphone

Mid-range, which represents the overwhelming majority of sales. Almost
all smartphones sold in 2021 have a screen larger than 5.5 inches.

> Its footprint is given by the GES-balance database.

## High-end smartphone

The GES-balance sheet database does not include "high-end phone" or
"screen > 6 inches" categories. Moreover, the footprint of an iPhone
11 estimated by Apple itself is 72kg of CO2e, of which 79% is ~57kg just
for the production. Unless the perimeter of the studies is not the same,
but a larger perimeter taken by the company than by the environmental
authority is surprising to say the least, we retain the value of the
manufacturer.

num√©rique . appareils . appareil photo.note: We put the camera in the digital category because of the scarcity of silver cameras today.
num√©rique . appareils . appareil photo.question: Do you use a camera?

num√©rique . appareils . appareil photo.note:
The lifespan of the devices changes according to the preservation coefficient determined by the question on the efforts to preserve its devices.
An answer "average effort" does not change the life span. Only the other answers increase or decrease the lifespan of the appliances and therefore the estimated carbon footprint.

No information on the life span is available either in ADEME studies or on the web (where the life span of a camera is approximated in thousands of shots).
We therefore consider a lifespan of 5 years.
