services publics . voter.description:
Every year or so, we each have the opportunity to
vote[for](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scrutins_en_France_sous_la_Cinqui√®me_R√©publique#2021%5B5%5D)
representatives who will defend our ideas.

Presidential, legislative, departmental and regional elections are the
opportunity to bring the subject of the climate, and therefore the
footprint of public services, and all the efforts that are complicated
to do alone.

But that's not all! If you're a student, maybe there are votes to guide
the work of the school or associations? If you are an employee, can you
influence the trips offered by the works council? If you are retired,
can you give your voice in the board of directors of your insurances, of
the banks which have your money?

services publics . pression locale.description:
The utility footprint is the footprint of lots of activities run by the
state but performed around your home.

> üö∏ Your children's school may be a heat sieve

> üõ£Ô∏è Your city is still building many miles of roads

The first step is to investigate, then simply discuss this with friends
and officials in a position to act.

services publics . changement banque.titre: Putting your savings in a responsible bank

services publics.description:
It is simply the total footprint of public services in France, divided
by our population.

It takes into account all CO2 emissions resulting from all public
services (health, roads, education, justice, defense...).

It is a position on which we have no direct influence as citizens,
except through our vote and our associative and political commitments.
services publics.note:
‚ö†Ô∏è Beware, there seems to be a lot of uncertainty about this figure. It
is a macroscopic reconstruction that appears to be based on financial
volumes by sector multiplied by a carbon intensity.

#### Our source

The figure is available in [this
spreadsheet](https://ree.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/IMG/xlsx/3_empreinte_carbone_v2.xlsx)
from this [ministry
study](https://ree.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/themes/defis-environnementaux/changement-climatique/empreinte-carbone/article/l-empreinte-carbone-de-la-france),
associated with the graph "Breakdown of the carbon footprint of the
French by major consumption items".

The report below is from 2019 but the figure for the utility footprint
appears to date back to 2014.

The previously stated sources are no longer available. Only one
reference to the 1.1 ton figure for utilities is available on
[notre-environnement.gouv.fr](https://www.notre-environnement.gouv.fr/donnees-et-ressources/ressources/graphiques/article/decomposition-de-l-empreinte-carbone-des-francais-par-grands-postes-de).
Moreover, an update of the study of the carbon footprint of the French
is underway and a more precise breakdown of this item should be
available soon, which could feed further reflections on this subject.

#### Other sources

The other sources available on this subject are the following.

-   Carbone4

[A MyCO2 publication by Carbone
4](https://www.myco2.fr/actus/empreinte-carbone-francaise-moyenne-comment-est-elle-calculee)
from January 2022 gives a figure of 1.4 tons for "Public expenditure".

![L'empreinte carbone fran√ßaise en
2019](https://www.myco2.fr/media/home/graphique-final.png)

These figures were obtained on the basis of the ministry's data with
some adjustments.

-   Ravijen.fr

This very interesting [blog post](http://ravijen.fr/?p=440) by R√©gis
Janvier estimates the footprint per year and per person of our public
services at 1498kg. Here is his comment:

> The public service part is also a sectoral update according to 2010
> data from Carbone4 and statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr.

services publics . question rh√©torique.question: We allocate the footprint of public services (education, health...) to each citizen equally.
services publics . question rh√©torique.description:
This category does not depend on your answers, [read
more](/documentation/services-publics).

transport . voiture . limitation autorou.description:
The Citizens' Climate Convention has proposed a reduction of the speed
limit on freeways from 130km/h to 110km/h in 2020. The proposal is
detailed
[here](https://propositions.conventioncitoyennepourleclimat.fr/objectif/reduire-les-emissions-des-gaz-a-effet-de-serre-sur-les-autoroutes-et-les-voies-rapides/#elementor-tab-title-1681).

Following the invasion of Ukraine by Russia, the International Energy
Agency has made this [its 1st
recommendation](https://www.iea.org/reports/a-10-point-plan-to-cut-oil-use)
to reduce our purchases of Russian oil.

We propose here an evaluation of this measure based on your specific
situation.
transport . voiture . limitation autorou.note: Be careful, everything in this formula is random for the moment :-D

transport . voiture . limitation autorou.description:
![](https://imgur.com/NB9CUUt.jpg) From this graph, by graphical
deduction (we have not yet gone back to the
[study](http://theses.univ-lyon2.fr/documents/getpart.php?id=1026&action=pdf)
data, page 151 figure 26), we find the following data

Diesel: 6.5 l/100 at 130km/h -> 4.75 at 110km/h

Gasoline: 11.75 l/100 at 130km/h -> 8.65 at 110km/h

So -27% in diesel and -26% in petrol by going from 130 to 110. We keep
the order of magnitude of 25%.
transport . voiture . limitation autorou.note:
This calculation should be refined. Some sources to investigate for the
calculation. - a citizen who makes his test for a clio. He finds a
reduction between -20% and -50%!
https://twitter.com/CptQwark\_/status/1289499582871658499 Another
citizen finds rather -10% with a bigger car. - [Report of the
CGDD](https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/sites/default/files/Th√©ma%20-%20R√©duction%20des%20vitesses%20sur%20les%20routes.pdf),
where we did not find for the moment the explanation of the calculation
of the CO2 saving - Aur√©lien Bigo who criticizes the report of the CGDD
https://twitter.com/AurelienBigo/status/1276459283291439114, but who
does not give us any information on the calculation of the CO2 itself. -
another evaluation, which gives us the calculation :) :
https://twitter.com/Tomsawy22670318/status/1274257122373570565 Be
careful, to be rigorous, as mentioned in this last thread, we have to
take into account the distribution of the speed and the category of car
(presence of a 6th gear for example). Obviously, we do not drive at 130
all the time.

transport . voiture . empreinte autorout.formule: empreinte . par km personne * km autoroute

transport . km autoroute.question: How many kilometers per year do you drive on the highway (approximately)?
transport . km autoroute.description: We travel about 80 billion km / year on the highway (car).

transport . arr√™ter l'avion.description:
Air travel has a significant climate footprint.

It is not limited to just CO‚ÇÇ emissions, which is just one greenhouse
gas among many.

The total footprint of air travel is estimated to be about 2x that of
CO‚ÇÇ.

See the [transportation calculator](https://monimpacttransport.fr) to
view this footprint and compare it to other means of transportation.
transport . arr√™ter l'avion.aller plus loin:
## For√ßage radiatif total

L'avion a un impact important sur le climat √† la fois √† cause de ses √©missions de CO‚ÇÇ et d'autres effets (dit for√ßage radiatif additionnel).

Du fait que les avions volent en haute altitude, la combustion du k√©ros√®ne cr√©e des tra√Æn√©es et perturbe les cycles d‚Äôautres gaz √† effet de serre que le CO‚ÇÇ (vapeur d'eau, eau condens√©e sous diverses formes, NOx et m√©thane qui, ensemble, produisent de l'ozone, etc.).

Ce graphique montre la complexit√© des effects en jeu (et encore, tout n'y est pas).

![](https://www.uecna.eu/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/ilusion-diagram1.jpg)

## Avion vs voiture

On entend souvent que ramen√©e au passager, elle est du m√™me ordre que celle d'une voiture. C'est vrai, mais ce n'est qu'une partie de l'histoire. 

Premi√®rement, l'empreinte de la voiture elle-m√™me est √©lev√©e. Comparer l'avion √† la voiture ne rend pas ce premier vertueux.

Deuxi√®mement, on ne peut comparer la voiture et l'avion simplement parce qu'un trajet en avion est en g√©n√©ral bien plus long. Quand il s'agit de choisir la destination des vacances par exemple, un trajet en voiture a donc toutes les chances d'√™tre beaucoup moins polluant. Cela dit, notons aussi que nos kilom√©trages en voiture sont tels que le match est relanc√© quand on regarde l'empreinte √† l'ann√©e.

transport . arr√™ter l'avion court.titre: Favouring the train over the plane
transport . arr√™ter l'avion court.description:
The airplane has changed our way of life and our way of traveling. We
can now go further, faster, more frequently, but unfortunately this is
not without a downside for the climate.

Indeed, there is a ratio of 100 between the emission factors (quantity
of CO2 emitted per km traveled) of a plane and a train.

> For example, a round trip from Paris to Marseille emits about 300
> kgCO2eq by plane against only 2 kgCO2eq by train.

This is why adapting our weekends and vacations by turning to low-carbon
mobility offers and/or by rethinking our way of traveling is essential
if we want to reduce our impact on the climate, both individually and as
a society

[Compare modes of transport here](https://monimpacttransport.fr)

transport . √©co-conduite.description:
Eco-driving is a simple and effective action that everyone can take.

It saves an average of 15% on fuel, reduces vehicle maintenance costs,
reduces the risk of accidents by an average of 10 to 15% and can result
in substantial savings of several hundred euros.

The application of eco-driving is all the more relevant in cities and
urban areas where stops and restarts are frequent.

transport . √©co-conduite . recalcul.note: A recalculation is necessary here, because the user may have used the input help tool which then prorates the km variable to the number of travelers. Otherwise it is not the case.

transport . √©co-conduite . usage r√©dui.formule: (transport . voiture . km * transport . voiture . empreinte . au kilom√®tre) * 0.85

transport . boulot . covoiturage.formule: distance * voiture . empreinte . au kilom√®tre * r√©duction covoiturage
transport . boulot . covoiturage.description:
While long-distance carpooling is well known in France, short-distance
carpooling is almost non-existent: today only 3% of home-to-work trips
are made by carpooling.

You should know that since 2020, you can ask your employer for the
[sustainable mobility
package](https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/actualites/A14046),
so that your carpooling is paid up to 400‚Ç¨/year, exempt from taxes and
social contributions!

In all cases, remember to adapt your mode of transport to the distance
and to favour soft modes or public transport (bus, metro, bike, walking,
etc.) as much as possible. The [My Transport
Impact](https://monimpacttransport.fr/) calculator allows you to
visualize and compare the impact of different modes of travel.

transport . r√©duction covoiturage.description:
One might naively think that carpooling divides the footprint per person
by 2. But in reality, a study carried out in the Ile-de-France region
shows that the reductions are more like 20%... before the rebound
effects, which reduce the final gain of carpooling to only 6%.

![](https://images.theconversation.com/files/297327/original/file-20191016-98644-c9y1zz.png?ixlib=rb-1.1.0&q=30&auto=format&w=754&h=588&fit=crop&dpr=2)

transport . boulot . semaines.description: 47 weeks, rather than 52 to take into account the 5 weeks of vacations.

transport . boulot . distance . hebdomad.formule: km aller * 2 * jours travaill√©s en voiture

transport . boulot . jours travaill√©s e.question: How many days a week do you drive to work?

transport . boulot . distance . km aller.question: How far from home is your work?
transport . boulot . distance . km aller.description:
We are talking here about the distance *to* the place of work, with the
mode of transport you prefer.

70% of workers in France work less than 15km from home.

57% work within 10km and 78% within 20km.

Source: INSEE 2004 and 2013 studies, stable figures.
transport . boulot . distance . km aller.note: Link to the study and update with 2020 travel survey statistics if available.

transport . boulot . commun.titre: Going to work other than by car
transport . boulot . commun.description:
When possible, taking public transport or light vehicles (walking,
cycling, personal scooter, ...) to work reduces our climate footprint,
but also improves our quality of life.

[70%](https://www.ecologie-solidaire.gouv.fr/covoiturage-en-france-avantages-et-reglementationen-vigueur)
of home-work trips are made with individual vehicles, most of them alone
in their cars. This is what we call auto-solism.

In addition to emitting a lot of greenhouse gases, this auto-soloing is
detrimental to the quality of the air in our cities and therefore to our
health, and it clogs up urban roads.

> As an example traffic jams represent in Ile-de-France per year and per
> person [163 hours
> lost](https://www.tomtom.com/en_gb/traffic-index/paris-traffic) or
> about 6 days.

> üí° Did you know? The State and many regions or cities subsidize
> mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. [Calculate your aid
> üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks](https://mesaidesvelo.fr).
transport . boulot . commun.formule: boulot . distance * gain empreinte au km

transport . boulot . seuil d'activation.description:
Minimum distance to trigger this action.

> If someone tells us that they only drive 200km in a year, they are
> unlikely to drive to work.

We define the threshold distance as 1km one way, for 5 days a week.

transport . boulot . commun . type.question: If you were to stop using your car to get to work, what other means of transportation could you use?

transport . TER . empreinte.description:
It is considered that a journey to work made by car can be replaced by a
regional train and not by a TGV.

transport . m√©tro ou tramway . empreint.formule: transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par km

transport . boulot . t√©l√©travail.description:
Telecommuting is a way to avoid the daily commute to work.

It is obviously not possible for many employees, but the health crisis
of 2020 has shown that many jobs are indeed telecommutable.

In this calculation, we only take into account the days teleworked that
avoid a trip by private car.
transport . boulot . t√©l√©travail.formule: empreinte jour voiture * jours gagn√©s * transport . boulot . semaines

transport . boulot . empreinte jour voit.formule: (distance . km aller * 2) * voiture . empreinte . au kilom√®tre

transport . boulot . jours t√©l√©travail.question: How many days per week could you telecommute?

transport . boulot . t√©l√©travail . com.question: Is your job fully or partially compatible with telecommuting?

transport . voiture 5km.titre: Do without a car for less than 5 km
transport . voiture 5km.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte - transport . voiture 5km . recalcul
transport . voiture 5km.description:
In France, 4 out of 10 car journeys are less than 3 km long and no less
than 177 million journeys of less than 5 km are made alone by car each
week (excluding home-work journeys).

Taken together, these "short" trips account for nearly 10% of the total
distance traveled by car in France each year.

Thus, turning to active mobilities (bike, scooter...) for these "short"
trips allows us to significantly reduce, our GHG emissions while
decongesting urban roads and improving the air quality of our polluted
cities.

> üí° Did you know? The state and many regions or cities subsidize
> mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. [Calculate your aid
> üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks](https://mesaidesvelo.fr).

transport . voiture 5km . seuil d'activa.description:
Minimum distance to trigger this action.

> If someone tells us that they only drive 200km in a year, it is
> unlikely to be 5km trips.
transport . voiture 5km . seuil d'activa.formule: nombre de semaines * distance moyenne . aller-retour

transport . voiture 5km . usage r√©duit.formule: (transport . voiture . km - distance totale) * transport . voiture . empreinte . au kilom√®tre

transport . voiture 5km . distance total.formule: fr√©quence * distance moyenne . aller-retour * nombre de semaines

transport . voiture 5km . distance moyen.description: We simply estimate the average distance of trips under 5km to be 2.5km.

transport . voiture 5km . fr√©quence.question: How many times a week do you drive less than 5km?
transport . voiture 5km . fr√©quence.description:
I go to get my bread 2km away by car, that's one trip. I go to work
every day from Monday to Friday at 4km, that's 5 trips.

transport . super ethanol.titre: Switching from unleaded to super ethanol
transport . super ethanol.applicable si: transport . voiture . thermique . carburant = 'essence E5 et E10'
transport . super ethanol.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte - transport . super ethanol . recalcul avec surconsommation
transport . super ethanol.description:
Superethanol E85 is the unleaded gasoline fuel that can contain between
65% and 85% of bioethanol, the complement being unleaded gasoline 95. It
is produced from sugar cane, cereals (wheat, corn) and sugar beet.

E85 is a competitive fuel: even taking into account the extra
consumption it generates, it allows a saving of 30 to 40 cents per liter
of SP95 replaced. To use it, it is possible to modify your gasoline
vehicle by installing an approved conversion box, for about 1000‚Ç¨,
amortized after 20 000 to 25 000 kilometers
![](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/pictures/KlhzqieXAJSG5N_Reou0UdhPLKM/0x667:800x2147/fit-in/720x/filters:format(webp)/2018/10/12/php6RnMqG.png)
transport . super ethanol.note: This action is inactive.  In view of the issues related to land use change and other environmental impacts related to the cultivation of corn for example, biofuels** are not taken into account (the emission factor of the carbon base being particularly uncertain). See discussions [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1324)

transport . super ethanol . taux surcons.note: The E85 superethanol is less energetic, so it increases the number of liters consumed [by 15 to 25%](https://www.ledauphine.com/magazine-lifestyle/2020/02/02/ce-que-vous-devez-savoir-sur-le-superethanol-e85-avant-de-vous-lancer).

transport . voiture √©lectrique.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte - transport . voiture √©lectrique . recalcul
transport . voiture √©lectrique.description:
The electric car is not a miracle solution, but for certain uses it can
be (very) useful in reducing our footprint.

However, we must be careful not to come to the simplistic conclusion
that it would be enough to switch to an electric car fleet to
decarbonize French travel.

The priority must be, when possible (55% of our trips [are less than
5km](https://twitter.com/GlmMrt/status/1481986507179274248)), the
development of active mobility (such as cycling) and public transport.

Nevertheless, the figure presented to you corresponds to the difference
in greenhouse gas emissions that would have occurred if you had driven
your kilometers with an electric vehicle instead of a thermal one.
transport . voiture √©lectrique.note: Consider proposing this action only if it > 0 or > several hundred kgCO2eq

transport . √¢ge nouvelle voiture √©lect.note: the age of a used car is considered to be 5 years.

transport . √¢ge nouvelle voiture √©lect.question: Are you considering buying a used electric car?
transport . √¢ge nouvelle voiture √©lect.description:
A used electric car costs less, of course. It also allows you to obtain
a [purchase
aid](https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F34014).

The battery autonomy may have decreased slightly, but remember that the
vast majority of our trips [are less than
50km](https://twitter.com/GlmMrt/status/1481986507179274248)!

transport . avion.description:
![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1525624286412-4099c83c1bc8?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=300&q=80)

The airplane's footprint is substantial. It is not necessarily more
polluting *per kilometer* than a car that moves only one person, but the
distance and especially the distance covered in one hour (commonly
called speed), allows to change continent for a weekend.

Let's also keep in mind that the average French person does not fly or
does not fly much. Most of the aviation footprint is therefore
concentrated on 10% or less of the French population.
transport . avion.note:
We have chosen to ask for the total number of flight hours, rather than
asking the user to fill in each of his flights via the airport of
departure, arrival and the economy class. This is a possible evolution
later, see [this
simulator](https://futur.eco/simulateur/transport/avion/impact) where
part of the work is already done.

Note also that stopovers lead to additional takeoffs, which consume more
fuel than a cruising speed. This is also a parameter to take into
account later.

For a more detailed model of the aircraft's footprint, we found two
sources.

The complete algorithm of the North app, available
[here](https://github.com/tmrowco/northapp-contrib/blob/master/co2eq/flights/index.js).

The pseudo-algorithm from myclimate.org, below.

![](https://imgur.com/hIVvuIw.jpg).

transport . avion . usager.question: Do you fly?
transport . avion . usager.description:
If you don't fly every year but plan to continue to do so, answer "yes"
and roughly estimate the number of hours you fly per year.

This is not very rigorous, but flying has such a large footprint on the
climate that it is important to take this into account.

> For example, if you took a 20-hour long-haul flight in 2018 and plan
> to take it again in 2022, we can assume that you take it every 4 years
> or so: just enter `5 hours` in the "long-haul" question.

transport . avion . court courrier.formule: heures de vol * vitesse moyenne * empreinte par km

transport . avion . court courrier . vit.note: We use the average flight speed for a Paris-Toulouse flight.

transport . avion . court courrier . emp.description:
We use the emission factor from the
`Passenger Aircraft - Short Range, 2018 - WITH drag`.

transport . avion . court courrier . heu.question: How many hours per year do you travel by plane in France?
transport . avion . court courrier . heu.description:
Count the number of hours you spent in an airplane for flights of less
than 1000km (give or take). If you have stopovers, simply add up the
times of each flight.

Suggestions are based on the minimum rounded flight time found in search
engines, doubled to consider a round trip.

üí° Only count personal travel and commuting miles to your usual place of
work. For example, if you are on a work assignment in another country,
this fits into your company's accounting.

transport . avion . moyen courrier.formule: heures de vol * vitesse moyenne * empreinte par km

transport . avion . moyen courrier . vit.note: We use the average flight speed for a Paris Algiers flight.

transport . avion . moyen courrier . emp.description:
We use the emission factor from the Carbon Baseline
`Passenger Aircraft - Medium Range, 2018 - WITH Trains`.

transport . avion . moyen courrier . heu.question: How many hours per year do you travel by plane to Europe or the Mediterranean basin?
transport . avion . moyen courrier . heu.description:
Count the hours you spent in an airplane for flights between 1000km and
3500km (roughly). If you have stopovers, simply add up the times of each
flight.

Suggestions are based on the minimum rounded flight time found in search
engines, doubled to consider a round trip.

üí° Only count personal travel and commuting miles to your usual place of
work. For example, if you are on a work assignment in another country,
this fits into your company's accounting.

transport . avion . long courrier.formule: heures de vol * vitesse moyenne * empreinte par km

transport . avion . long courrier . vite.note: We use the average flight speed of the MicMac v2.6 model, determined from [this data](http://www.abm.fr/voyager-en-avion-le-guide-du-passager/en-complement/distances-et-durees-de-vol.html).

transport . avion . long courrier . empr.description:
We use the emission factor from the carone base
`Passenger Aircraft - Long Range, 2018 - WITH drag`.

transport . avion . long courrier . heur.question: How many hours a year do you travel beyond that on long-haul flights?
transport . avion . long courrier . heur.description:
Count the hours you spent in an airplane for flights longer than 3500km,
i.e. beyond Europe and the Mediterranean.

If you have stopovers, simply add up the times of each flight.

Suggestions are based on the minimum rounded flight time found in search
engines, doubled to consider a round trip.

üí° Only count personal travel and commuting miles to your usual place of
work. For example, if you are on a work assignment in another country,
this fits into your company's accounting.

transport . vacances . camping car . pro.question: Do you own a motor home?

transport . vacances . camping car . emp.formule: voiture . gabarit . berline . empreinte * (camping car . poids / voiture . gabarit . berline . poids)
transport . vacances . camping car . emp.note:
We extrapolate the impact of the manufacturing of a caravan from a ratio on the weight and by considering the data of construction "Sedan" (6300 kgCO2e and 1500 t)
Source Figure 6 and table 1 [FNH-Carbone4](https://europeanclimate.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/quelle-contribution-du-vehicule-electrique-a-la-transition-ecologique-en-france.pdf)
We consider a weight of 3t for the camper van, the rolling limit (with a B license) is 3,5t (which leaves 500 kg for the interior).

transport . vacances . camping car . dur.note:
A lifetime of [25 years](https://objectifpleinair.com/combien-de-temps-dure-un-camping-car/) is considered.
This assumption needs to be better sourced

transport . vacances . camping car . km.question: How far do you travel per year in your motorhome?
transport . vacances . camping car . km.description:
Please note that these motorhome miles should not be entered in the car
miles (a question you have probably already answered), they are two
different questions.

transport . vacances . camping car . con.question: Do you know the average consumption of your motorhome?
transport . vacances . camping car . con.note: By default, we consider a consumption of [15 l per 100 km](http://www.france-camping-car.fr/utilisation/consommation-camping-car.php)

transport . vacances . camping car . emp.formule: consommation au kilom√®tre * empreinte au litre
camping car . km * empreinte au kilom√®tre

transport . vacances . caravane . emprei.note: We consider an overconsumption for the km covered with the caravan.

transport . vacances . caravane . surcon.formule: voiture . empreinte . au kilom√®tre * ratio surconsommation

transport . vacances . caravane . ratio.note:
1.2 to 1.5 l/100 km [here](https://www.lemondedupleinair.com/comment-limiter-sa-consommation-de-carburant-en-tractant-une-caravane/) which can be estimated at an overconsumption of 10 to 20%
40 to 50% [here](https://forum.lescaravaniers2.com/viewtopic.php?t=9973)
As a first approximation, we therefore consider a hypothesis of 25% overconsumption

transport . vacances . caravane . distan.question: How far do you travel per year in your caravan?
transport . vacances . caravane . distan.description:
Note that to do these caravan miles, you did them with a car: so you
must have included them in the car miles (a question you probably
already answered).

üí° This question serves us to apply the overconsumption of the towing of
your caravan to a part of your car km.

transport . vacances . caravane . emprei.formule: voiture . gabarit . berline . empreinte * (caravane . poids / voiture . gabarit . berline . poids)
transport . vacances . caravane . emprei.note:
We extrapolate the impact of the manufacturing of a caravan from a ratio on the weight and by considering the data of construction "Sedan" (6300 kgCO2e and 1500 t)
Source Figure 6 and Table 1 [FNH-Carbone4](https://europeanclimate.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/quelle-contribution-du-vehicule-electrique-a-la-transition-ecologique-en-france.pdf)
We consider a weight of 750 kg for a caravan.

transport . vacances . caravane . dur√©e.note:
As for the motor home, a lifetime of [25 years] is considered (https://objectifpleinair.com/combien-de-temps-dure-un-camping-car/).
This assumption needs to be better sourced.

transport . voiture.description:
![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1572312284222-ecf6d70f1907?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=400&q=80)

Today in France, cars are mainly thermal (gasoline, diesel), although
electric cars are slowly progressing.

However, electric or thermal, it remains a very inefficient means of
transportation: **on average, it is necessary to move a human being of
80kg in a metal box of 1200kg**.

It's as if every day at lunchtime, we made food for 10 people and then
threw away 90% of the food, or decided to heat the whole block instead
of the inside of each of the 10 houses.

Finally, let's note that it is important to take into account both the
use (the kilometers traveled) and the construction of this vehicle of
more than one ton of various materials.

transport . voiture . voyageurs.question: What is the average number of passengers in the car?
transport . voiture . voyageurs.description:
A car consumes about the same amount of fuel whether it has 1, 2 or 5
passengers on board. Traveling with several people is therefore
potentially dividing the individual footprint by 5!

ü§î But this question is not easy: it is likely that in a year you went on
vacation with 3 people, took the car daily alone, etc.

Try to estimate a rough average: if every day you take the car alone,
put 1 or 1.2. If you only drive with family or friends, put 3 or 4.

> In a future evolution of the simulator, we will be able to separate
> the questions by type of trip: vacation, home-work, daily with a
> customizable number of travelers.

Of course, if you have a driver or if you take a cab, the driver does
not count, because he is at the service of your trip.

transport . voiture . notif minimum voya.description:
The number of passengers cannot be zero. At the wheel of your car, you
are the first traveler.

transport . voiture . aide km.question: Was the user assisted in filling in the number of kilometers by car, this number being already prorated by the number of passengers for each trip?

transport . voiture . ratio voyageurs.question: If the user has been assisted to fill in the number of kilometers, what is the ratio between the gross sum of kilometers, and the sum of kilometers divided by the number of travelers on the trip?
transport . voiture . ratio voyageurs.note:
The issue of this variable concerns the attribution of the emissions of
the car's construction. The "usage" part already takes into account the
number of passengers in the car via the prorated kms.

There are two solutions:

Use the number of average passengers (weighted by the kms): average
passengers = (Aa+Bb+C\*c) / (A+B+C)

OR

Use the ratio gross km / real km prorated : gross km = A + B + C ; real
km prorated = A/a + B/b + C/c

We have simulated the 2 options:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TMe\_49JW0djDFHLtejWcIs3CRCt4vh3PJUvm7NtH0co.

Option 1 (weighted average) was chosen because it seems to be more
representative of the "time" (km) actually spent in the car by the user.

transport . voiture . km.question: How far do you travel per year by car?
transport . voiture . km.description:
Only count the kilometers of personal travel (shopping, leisure, family,
etc.) and of travel to and from work to reach your usual place of work.

For example, if you are on a professional mission in another department
or another country, this is included in your company's accounting: do
not count it here.
transport . voiture . km.note: Source for average annual km: [datalab ministry of ecology 2019](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/bilan-annuel-des-transports-en-2019-0), page 3 G1.

transport . voiture . motorisation.question: What type of car do you use?
transport . voiture . motorisation.description:
If you use more than one car (for example, if you don't own one), choose
the answer that best represents your usage.

> Note: you are surprised to see this question when you answered "no" to
> "Do you have your own car"? This is normal: as soon as you drive a
> car, we need to know its characteristics, even if it is not yours, to
> calculate your footprint.

transport . voiture . gabarit.question: What is the size of the car?
transport . voiture . gabarit.description:
The heavier and taller a car is, and therefore the more wind it blows,
the more it consumes and therefore the more it pollutes!

As for the engine, if you use several cars (for example if you don't own
one), choose the answer that best represents your use.

transport . voiture . thermique . consom.question: Do you know the average consumption of the car?
transport . voiture . thermique . consom.description:
As for the engine, if you use several cars (for example if you don't own
one), choose the answer that best represents your use.
transport . voiture . thermique . consom.note: Suggestions for answers are in the form of a ladle, to be specified and sourced.

transport . voiture . consommation estim.note:
The correspondence table is only indicative, it is far from being
rigorously set on the statistics of cars in circulation in France: the
main thing is that the user enters his *real* consumption.

That said, the "average" gauge is based on the average **diesel** value
(most common fuel, 2x gasoline) of 6.1l/100km in 2019 of the Ministry of
the Environment's transport balance sheet:
[source](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/bilan-annuel-des-transports-en-2019-0)
figure G3-4 page 9.

transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.formule: consommation au kilom√®tre * empreinte au litre
transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.note: This calculation method, rather than a gauge -> footprint per km scale, allows the user who knows the real average consumption of his car to enter it for more accuracy.

transport . voiture . √©lectrique . empr.note:
We make the following correspondence between our size and the data of
the balance sheet-GES database: - small -> "entry level - light
vehicle" - medium -> "mid-range - compact vehicle" - sedan and SUV
-> "top of the range - sedan"

transport . voiture . empreinte . au kil.note:
For the hybrid car, we have not used the values of the GES-balance for
the moment, because they are complicated to interpret: - the "plug-in
hybrid" category has a surprisingly small footprint (on the level of
electric), but mostly 0 emissions at combustion. So it would be a
gasoline vehicle that doesn't use gasoline in use? \[A recent topic\] on
the GES-balance forum does not explain the inconsistency. - the
difference between full hybrid Prius and full hybrid P2 is not explained
- in these 2 categories, there is no entry level.

The FNH-Carbone4 study could be used for the footprint per km of plug-in
hybrids. The structural assumption is as follows:

> Split of driving modes (thermal / electric) for hybrids: 50% / 50% in
> 2016

However, we note the recent controversy over the footprint of plug-in
hybrids following [a
study](https://www.transportenvironment.org/press/les-hybrides-rechargeables-au-c≈ìur-d‚Äôun-nouveau-scandale-d‚Äô√©missions-des-tests-r√©v√®lent-des)
by Transport & Environnement which reported a real footprint that was
incomparable to the footprint announced by the manufacturers.

For the moment, we have used the calculation of the MicMac calculator
which is the basis of Nos Gestes Climat, whose source is unfortunately
inaccessible:

> Hybrid: remove 15% from the above consumption (source ADEME:
> http://www2.ademe.fr/servlet/KBaseShow?catid=13655)

transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.description:
The footprints are available in some detail on [the carbon
base](https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/basecarbone/donnees-consulter/liste-element?recherche=diesel),
here for example for "diesel". Same for "gasoline". To find them easily,
filter by unit "kgCO2e/liter" and by geography "continental France".

Note that for diesel, the FE chosen is the average between B7 diesel and
B10 diesel.

transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.question: What type of fuel does your car use?
transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.description:
To understand the different types of fuels, [this educational
article](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/economie/automobile/essence/les-carburants-changent-de-nom-a-la-pompe-voici-comment-vous-y-retrouver_2967013.html)
is very useful.

[This
article](https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/carburants-et-combustibles-autorises-en-france)
from the Ministry of Ecology explains in more detail the fuels legal in
France.

> Be careful, if the type of fuel varies significantly the climate
> footprint per liter, the consumption in liter per 100km also varies.
> Be sure to enter a consumption per liter based on your actual average.
transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.note:
The dominance of diesel and gasoline is overwhelming,
[source](https://www.leprogres.fr/magazine-automobile/2021/03/27/quels-sont-les-carburants-les-plus-utilises-dans-votre-commune).

In contrast, among new vehicles, gasoline now dominates.

The emission factor associated with E85 biofuel is not representative of
the environmental consequences of biofuel use. Indeed, in view of the
issues related to land use change and other environmental impacts
related to the cultivation of corn for example, **biofuels** are not
taken into account (the emission factor of the carbon base being
particularly uncertain). See our discussions
[here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1324).

transport . voiture . notif carburant.description:
Your vehicle runs on biofuel: Beyond the carbon footprint of biofuels,
we must be aware that they have a footprint on the soil: this soil could
be used to grow grains to feed us or serve as biodiversity refuges. This
is called "land use change" here for biofuel production. Unfortunately,
the climate impact of this land use change is difficult to quantify and
particularly uncertain.

We have chosen to add this option in the test, but it should be noted
that this result **is not representative of the likely environmental
consequences of biofuel use**.

transport . voiture . empreinte . constr.description:
![](https://i.imgur.com/uIlZcEjl.jpg)

A car is a large, very large object, often weighing more than a ton and
a half. As a result, its construction has a significant footprint.

In particular, the construction of an electric car of equivalent range
to a thermal one emits more greenhouse gases. This is mainly due to the
battery and its heavy weight.

Despite this, in France, over the life of the car and therefore the
number of kilometers driven, the choice of an electric car is clearly
better for the climate.

Better, but far from weak! In 2020, it is no longer just a matter of
comparing technical solutions, it is a matter of evaluating one's
purchases in relation to climate objectives.
transport . voiture . empreinte . constr.note:
We use the [FNH-Carbone4] study (https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/files/5945898/vehicule_electrique_rapport.pdf).

For now, we have only two templates, the city car and the sedan.

p. 12.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107264406-3afdd980-6a43-11eb-87ad-a09681240949.png)

We take "production and end of life" and subtract "recycling credits" from it, and 2016 data rather than the 2030 prospective scenario.

pp. 57-58.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107265071-1eae6c80-6a44-11eb-9b51-c2aee3bfcf3c.png)
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107265098-2706a780-6a44-11eb-8681-7901f00e057b.png)
Surprisingly, the sedan has a smaller footprint than the city car... Let's see if the study picks up this mystery.

transport . voiture . √¢ge.question: How old is your car?
transport . voiture . √¢ge.description:
To calculate the footprint of the car's construction, which should not
be neglected, we use the car's age.

Be sure to answer with *the age of the* car, not the number of years
you've owned it: chances are you bought it used.

If there are two of you using two cars, you can simply assign one to
yourself, or enter an average of their characteristics.

If you own several cars that you use only yourself, ~~sell at least the
second one~~ this case is not yet planned.

transport . voiture . amortissement part.description:
When you buy a car, you emit a given quantity of GHGs. Let's say for
example, 10 tons, for a 10 years life span of the car. These gases are
emitted in the year of purchase, or more or less (some components will
have already been produced).

It would therefore be logical from the point of view of the climate
footprint, to attribute the emissions of the construction to the first
year: the warming greenhouse effect starts from the purchase!

Except that many cars are bought by companies before being sold
second-hand to individuals, or between individuals. It seems therefore
legitimate to distribute the allocation over time, therefore as the
owners go along. In the same way, we must also think about users who
discover this tool only the year following the purchase of a car: it is
legitimate to reserve a part of the emissions for them.

Secondly, attributing the entire footprint to the purchase of a car
would send a strong signal that would disadvantage the choice of an
electric car over a combustion engine, whereas in France the emissions
of the latter catch up with the former as soon as they are used.

Hence the choice to amortize the purchase over the first 10 years (the
average life of a car), with a decreasing rate, making sure that the sum
of the share of each year gives 100%.

In short, we make a compromise between a model that is coherent from a
climate point of view and a model that is more practical in the context
of an educational simulator that is not necessarily used every year.

To see the thinking that led to this method, see [this
discussion](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/issues/225#issuecomment-689472950).
transport . voiture . amortissement part.note: When we have updated the code with the latest version of publi.codes, we can use the [grid mechanism](https://publi.codes/m√©canismes#grille) which does exactly that.

transport . voiture . dur√©e de vie.description:
We consider that a private car, like a rental car, is used on average 19
years before being scrapped
[.](https://www.largus.fr/actualite-automobile/le-top-15-des-voitures-envoyees-a-la-casse-10348407.html)

Indeed, many cars are for example bought new by leasing companies, and
will then be acquired by a private individual second hand.

transport . voiture . facteur location.note: The impact of the construction is attributed to the user on a pro rata basis in relation to the number of kilometers driven by the car over a year.

transport . voiture . propri√©taire.question: Do you have your own private car?
transport . voiture . propri√©taire.description:
This is in contrast to the exclusive use of rental cars shared by other
people the rest of the time, or the use of a friend's or family's car.

If your company provides you with a car of which you are the primary
user, you can consider it your own car.

transport . voiture . notif proprio.description:
You do not own a car, but you still drive kilometers: we must therefore
ask you the characteristics of the cars you use as a passenger or driver
(rental car, friends' car).

transport . empreinte.description:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg/640px-Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg)

Unsurprisingly, transportation, and above all petroleum-based
transportation, is a very large part of our footprint.

transport . vacances.question: What do you have for your weekends, your vacations?
transport . vacances.description:
Here we suggest you to select what you have for your vacations. For the
moment, the choice is restricted to the caravan and the motor home.

> Note that their footprint is separated into two: the use part is added
> to the transport while the construction part is integrated into the
> accommodation.

üí° If you don't own a camper or a caravan, or if you rent them, you can
click "Next" without checking anything. Rental is not yet available in
our model\*\*.

transport . vacances . maison secondaire.question: Do you own a second home?

transport . train . impact par km.note:
We choose not to differentiate TGV and TER for the moment (to avoid asking two questions)
We could add a slider to evaluate the weighting of the average and be more precise. Today we are at 50/50.
We therefore take the average emission factor between TER and TGV.

transport . train . TER.note: TER - 2019 - Average traction; 29.6 gCO2e/km/person; Carbon base consulted on 04/04/2022 (SNCF data)

transport . train . TGV.note: TGV - 2019; 2.36 gCO2e/km/person; Carbon base consulted on 04/04/2022 (SNCF data)

transport . train . km.question: How many kilometers do you travel by train per year?
transport . train . km.description:
Suggestions are based on the distance as the crow flies doubled to
consider a round trip.

transport . m√©tro ou tram.formule: heures par semaine * impact par heure * nombre de semaines

transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par.note: We have confused streetcar and subway, while the MicMac v2.6 model only talks about subway.
transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par.description: Based on 6.63 gCO2e/(passenger.km) and an average speed of 25 km/h.

transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par.note: Metro, tramway, trolleybus - 2018 - Urban area > 250 000 inhabitants; 3.29 gCO2e/km/person; Carbon base consulted on 04/04/2022

transport . m√©tro ou tram . vitesse.note: Assumption of 25 km/h average speed, transports.blog.lemonde.fr, accessed on 05/09/2014

transport . m√©tro ou tram . heures par.question: How many hours a week do you spend on the metro or streetcar?

transport . bus.formule: heures par semaine * impact par heure * nombre de semaines

transport . bus . impact par heure.description: Based on 166 gCO2e/(passenger.km) and an average speed of 12 km/h

transport . bus . impact par km.note:
Bus - Diesel; 113 gCO2e/km/person; Carbon base consulted on 04/04/2022
As the fleet is mostly diesel in France (https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/69-000-autocars-en-circulation-au-1er-janvier-2020), we have chosen to use this EF (more reliable than the reference "average bus" according to the carbon base)
Taking into account the other engines of this category of the carbon base will decrease this EF (by weighting according to the characteristics of the French fleet). (Ex: Bus - Electric = 21.7 gCO2e/km/person)

transport . bus . vitesse.note: Assumption of 12 km/h average speed, Paris City Hall, consulted on 05/09/2014

transport . bus . heures par semaine.question: How many hours do you spend on a bus per week?

transport . v√©lo . empreinte.description:
Cycling is a super sober mode of transportation: you use 15 kilos of
material to move a ~70 kilo body.

In full explosion, the electric-assist bike allows you to start cycling
regularly with very little increase in the footprint of this means of
transportation.

Ditto for all vehicles under 50 kilos.

> Tip: your shoes are a vehicle under 50kg.
transport . v√©lo . empreinte.note:
We consider the bicycle to have a zero footprint

It is still possible to attribute to it an easily amortized construction footprint, and the footprint of the excess calories, which depends on the diet

We have all the ingredients here to do this, but it's not nearly as simple. Extra physical activity is also associated with much lower health risks and therefore expenses.

transport . v√©lo . km.question: How many kilometers of cycling or walking do you do per week?
transport . v√©lo . km.description:
üö¥ üõ¥ üëü

Fill in the miles by conventional bicycle, electric-assist bicycle,
scooter, and other sober vehicle here.

> A sober vehicle is light (less than 30 kilos for example) and low
> speed (less than 25km/h, which allows you to use bike lanes).

But don't worry too much about accuracy: the footprint of these sober
modes is considered zero here, so your answer will have no consequence
üòÑ.

> Note: üõó the elevator is the most forgotten electric transit! It has no
> more footprint in order of magnitude than the electric bike.
transport . v√©lo . km.note: The default figure is a rough estimate with no source, but it doesn't matter given the final zero impact.

transport . deux roues thermique . usage.question: Do you use a scooter or motorcycle?
transport . deux roues thermique . usage.description:
Scooters and motorcycles are nowadays mostly petrol-powered machines.
The electric equivalents have made their appearance, but timidly.

transport . deux roues thermique . km.question: How many kilometers do you drive per year with your scooter or motorcycle?

transport . deux roues thermique . type.question: What type of thermal two-wheeler do you use?

transport . deux roues thermique . empre.note:
Moped - Mixed - 2018; 76.3 gCO2e/km/person; ADEME calculations based on HBEFA (2020)

Motorcycle =< 250 cm3 - Mixed - 2018; 76.3 gCO2e/km/person; ADEME calculations based on HBEFA (2020)

Motorcycle > 250 cm3 - Mixed - 2018; 191 gCO2e/km/person; ADEME calculations based on HBEFA (2020)


The above figures include vehicle manufacturing, unlike the previous data (2021).

transport . deux roues thermique . conso.note: Data from HBEFA according to the carbon base documentation (https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD_DOC_FR/index.htm?routier2.htm)
